spells.summary: Can use [Block] while underwater

spells.name: ⏩△Rare Runner
spells.description:
The leg strength of running birds is infused into the target, resulting in great speed, but at the cost of physical strain.

When affected by this spell, the target chooses a number from 1 to 10 to receive as fixed damage to their HP. Then, for the duration of the spell, the target's movement speed (see CR II, p. 53 or CR I, p. 390) is increased by the same amount as the fixed damage received. The target only takes this fixed damage on the first turn.

If the target character has multiple sections, all sections must receive fixed damage for the movement increase.
spells.summary: Movement increased up to +10 in exchange for damage

spells.name: Natural Power II
spells.description:
Caster draws magic from nature and uses it to temporarily fuel spells. Upon casting this spell, the caster gains Power 30 MP (no criticals). This MP can only be used to cast Nature Magic and may be combined with the caster's own MP or with a Mako Stone.

This spell only works if the caster is in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101).

The temporary MP granted by this spell disappears at the end of the caster's turn.

Note: Since this spell requires a Major Action to cast, the temporary MP gained by this spell is generally used to cast Nature Magic with a Minor Action. However, it is possible to allocate extra MP to Nature Magic cast with a Major Action by declaring the Combat Feat [Double Cast], receiving the effect of the [Haste] spell, and so on.
spells.summary: Gain temporary MP

spells.name: Sense Magic
spells.description:
Senses the presence of magic in a target object.

Caster knows if magic is present or not, but not the name, type, effect, system, if it is permanent or temporary, or how many spells are affecting the target.
spells.summary: Find out if any spells were cast

spells.name: Toxic Breeze
spells.description: Causes a poisonous wind to blow, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power magical Poison damage to the target.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage

spells.name: Reincarnation
spells.description:
This spell is only effective on a corpse less than 24 hours old. The target's soul will be reborn in a child within the next 7 days. This new entity will not remember anything from their previous life until they reach a certain age, as determined by this spell's Spellcasting check. However, the child will grow up to have all of the same ability scores as the old character, and once they reach a certain age, they regain all memories of their past life, including class levels and Combat Feats.

The age at which their memory is regained depends on the success value at the time of the cast (not on the target's race).

This spell takes 1 hour to cast.

If the target is resurrected before the seven days is up, the effect of this spell is automatically negated. If the target was already affected by [Reincarnation], casting this spell again will not revive the target again (but another spell will).
spells.power_table:
Success Value Age to Regain Memory
25 or less Will not regain memory naturally
26-27 30 years old
28-29 20 years old
30-31 10 years old
32+ 5 years old
spells.summary: Give a departed soul a new life

spells.name: Blood Bath*
spells.description:
This spell creates a force field around the caster that siphons life force from nearby enemies.

Once every 10 seconds (1 round), the caster deals 3 points of fixed damage to all enemy characters within the area of effect. At the same time, the caster's HP is restored by an amount equal to the total damage dealt. If an affected character has [Poison Immunity] or similar effect, it still takes the fixed damage, but it does not count towards the caster's HP recovery.

If used in combat, this effect occurs at the end of the caster's turn.
spells.summary: Enemy characters take 3 damage per turn; caster's HP restored by damage dealt

spells.name: Mind Bomb
spells.description:
The target receives a -4 penalty on Spellcasting checks and on the success value of Performance checks.

If the target cannot hear the spell, it has no effect.
spells.summary: Spellcasting and Performance checks -4

spells.name: Summon Aetherbeast*
spells.description:
Summons an Aetherbeast.

Immediately after being summoned, the monster acts according to "Obey Command" (see Magus Arts, p. 87). However, it acts on its own will and judgment if no instructions are given.
spells.summary: Summon and command Aetherbeast

spells.name: Desultory
spells.description: Disturbs concentration and disrupts magic. The target's Spellcasting checks receive a -4 penalty for the spell's duration.
spells.summary: Spellcasting checks -4 to target

spells.name: ⏩Sacred Aura*
spells.description: Any [Sacred Shield] or [Sacred Weapon] spells cast by the caster for the duration of this spell will also affect Daemons.
spells.summary: [Sacred …] spells also affect Daemons

spells.name: Preservation
spells.description:
The affected item will not rot or decay in any manner.

If used on a corpse, this spell will freeze the number of days elapsed since death when checking for soulscars.
spells.summary: Protects objects from decomposition

spells.name: Firestorm
spells.description: Creates a tornado of whirling flame, dealing Power 40 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 40 damage

spells.name: Promise Circle*
spells.description:
When a target uses an effect that would cost MP during their turn, they have the option to use MP from another character affected by this spell instead. In this case, the target and other characters can share MP in any ratio. Only the target's own MP can be used (for example, mako stones possessed by the target cannot be used). [MP Save/**] and similar combat feats can only affect their owner and will not affect the person using the owner's mana.

Upon casting, caster can exclude characters within the affected area of this spell without needing the [Magic Control] combat feat.
spells.summary: Shares MP

spells.name: Quest
spells.description:
Assigns a mission to the target. The exact details of the mission are left up to the caster, but the parameters (success, failure, any restrictions, etc.) must be clearly defined.

If the target consciously delays going on the quest or actively tries to fail, they will receive 1 fixed point of damage per round.

Once the quest has been fulfilled, this effect ends.
spells.summary: Hand down a divine quest

spells.name: Chaos Explosion
spells.description: Combines the power of the fairy into the ultimate explosion, dealing Power 80 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 80 damage

spells.name: Scapegoat*
spells.description:
The caster can redirect any applied damage to any character in the affected area as fixed damage to the caster.

For the spell's duration, the caster is treated as if they have acquired the combat feat [Indomitable], and will automatically succeed (HP becomes 1) if they roll 10 or more on Death Checks during the spell's duration.

This spell can only be cast once per day.
spells.summary: Caster takes all damage in area
spells.divinity: Miritsa, Goddess of Love and Vengeance

spells.name: Forbid Magic
spells.description:
Caster selects a single magic system (Truespeech, Spiritual, Fairy Magic, etc.) and prevents the target from casting spells from that magic system at level 3 or below.

If the caster selects multiple targets using the [Metamagic/Targets] combat feat, the caster can choose only one magic system to suppress for all targets.
spells.summary: Prohibits spells level 3 or below from a selected magic system

spells.name: ⏩Mana Convergence
spells.description: Concentrates mana on the caster's hand or implement. When the caster casts a "Range: Touch" spell, the caster's Magic Power is increased by +1.
spells.summary: Gives Magic Power +1 for spells with Range: Touch

spells.name: △Disclose Daemons*
spells.description:
Caster gains insight from stars regarding the ecology and characteristics of Daemons.

This spell can be cast during Combat Preparation. The caster gains a +2 bonus to the Monster Knowledge check for Daemon monsters immediately following the check. If multiple Monster Knowledge checks for Daemons are required, this effect is applied to all of them.
spells.summary: Monster Knowledge check +2 for Daemons

spells.name: Inspiration*
spells.description:
When the caster performs a skill check included in the Observation or Knowledge check packages (see CR I, p. 114), the result of the check can be an automatic success (assuming double 6s are rolled) without rolling any dice.

This effect disappears after one use. This spell can only be cast once per day.
spells.summary: Automatically succeed on any Observation or Knowledge check

spells.name: Charm*
spells.description:
The target becomes less wary of the caster, even if initially hostile. The target will treat the caster as a close friend, trying not to hinder them as much as possible and trusting what the caster says. However, the target will not trust any actions or behaviors actively detrimental to their health.

This effect immediately ends if the caster is actively hostile toward the target. For the next 6 hours, the target gains a +4 bonus to Willpower.
spells.summary: Entices the target, causing them to be less vigilant

spells.name: Translate
spells.description:
The caster gains the ability to understand the meaning of unknown writing. The language can only be read; they cannot speak it aloud or understand it if it is spoken to them. The effect only allows the caster to read one language at a time, which must be specified at the time of invocation. The caster can read a language even if they don't know its name or have never encountered it before, as long as they have the written text in front of them.

The caster cannot decipher artificial ciphers, code phrases, narrow terms, or grammatically incorrect sentences without context. They will only recognize them as ciphers, signs, or broken phrases.

To speak and/or understand a spoken language, see the [Tongues] spell.
spells.summary: Caster understands the meaning of any written work just by looking

spells.name: Stone Wall
spells.description:
A stone wall is erected with a thickness of 50cm, a height of 3m, and a length of 10m as its upper limit. The wall completely blocks sight and prevents creatures, objects, "Area: Shot" and "Area: Line" spells, and unique skills from passing through. It must be built directly perpendicular to the ground and cannot overlap or penetrate an existing object or creature.

The caster can create a stone wall of any stone. However, the wall cannot be transparent.

See also: "Note on Spells That Create Walls" (Magus Arts, page 76).
spells.summary: Erects a stone wall

spells.name: Prism Effect
spells.description: Refracts light to make the caster invisible to machines. The caster cannot be seen by Mechanical means of perception, whether by monsters or magical items (like visual recorders). If the caster is in the target of an attack or an Evasion: Can't effect from a monster with Mechanical perception, 1d is rolled before the attack. On a 1-3, the caster must use their Evasion to dodge the attack as normal. On a 4-6, the caster automatically dodges the attack, with no Evasion roll required. Characters that use Five Senses or Magic perception can see the character normally.
spells.summary: Makes caster invisible to characters with Mechanical perception

spells.name: Deafness*
spells.description: The target loses hearing and is unable to hear any sound. Follow the rules for deafness (see CR II, p. 71).
spells.summary: Make the target lose hearing

spells.name: Hide in Shadow*
spells.description:
Casters can intuitively understand and place themselves in shadows and blind spots. The caster gains a +2 bonus to Hide checks.

Also, when the caster makes an Evasion check during combat, they gain a +2 bonus to the Evasion check if there is a third character present (other than the caster and the character attempting the Accuracy check).
spells.summary: Hide check +2, Evasion check +2 when more than two characters in same coordinates

spells.name: Healing Image
spells.description:
This spell heals Power 0 + Magic Power.

This spell also affects Undead, Constructs, and Magitech.

 
Enhancement 1:

This spell can be cast using a Minor Action and during Combat Preparation. If done so, the Spellcasting Check is omitted. When using this spell in a Minor Action, it can only be used once per round on the same target.

After using this spell with a Minor Action, it is also possible to use it again with a Major Action.

Enhancement 2:

Change Spell to "Range/Area: 2 (50m) / Target."
spells.summary: Recovers the target with Power 0.

spells.name: Enticing Aroma*
spells.description:
Targets are distracted by the aroma of a sumptuous meal.

The targets receive a -2 penalty to all skill checks.
spells.summary: Distracts by the aroma of the meal, action checks -2

spells.name: Drunk*
spells.description:
Generate an alcohol mist around the target, making them inhale it, thus intoxicating and then putting them to sleep.

This sleep is treated as Psychic (Weak) type. However, even after waking up, if the target was affected by this, they remain intoxicated for the duration of the effect and receive a -1 penalty to all skill checks.

This magic has no effect on characters who do not sleep.
spells.summary: Intoxicates and puts the target to sleep

spells.name: Thorn Bash
spells.description: Dancing Thorn's Spirit hits the target with its body. Roll 2d and determine the physical damage dealt to the target using the table below.
spells.power_table:
2d Damage
2-6 The spikes graze and cut shallowly. This attack deals 4 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
7-9 Some of the branches hit the target, dealing 7 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
10-12 Several branches gouge deeply, resulting in 13 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
spells.summary: Deals (4-13 + Magic Power) physical damage

spells.name: Daemon's Scream
spells.description:
The caster lets out the cry of a Daemon, causing the surrounding area to cower in fear.

The target takes -2 to Fortitude and Willpower.
spells.summary: Target's Fortitude and Willpower -2

spells.name: Water Screen
spells.description: Spell covers the target's body with water and protects it from heat and flames. Whenever the target receives Fire-type magic damage, reduce it by 3 points.
spells.summary: Fire damage -3 for the covered target

spells.name: Vitality
spells.description: Revitalizes the life force of the target. The target receives a +2 bonus on Fortitude checks.
spells.summary: Fortitude +2

spells.name: Drive Away*
spells.description:
Wears down the target with multiple troubles.

The target receives a -1 penalty for each Evasive or Willpower check made in response to a hostile action made with a Major Action. This effect is cumulative up to -4 for each effect check individually but disappears when the target's turn comes. If the target performs an Evasion check or a Willpower check within the time limit, the effect of the spell remains. The penalty is applied and accumulated again each time the target performs an Evasion check or a Willpower check.
spells.summary: -1 per check to Evasion or Willpower (max -4/round)

spells.name: Great Snare
spells.description: Earth fairies grab the enemy's legs and pull them to the ground. The target is rendered prone regardless of their number of sections and method of movement. Characters that move without touching the ground are unaffected.
spells.summary: Earth fairies grab the enemy's legs and pull them to the ground

spells.name: Poison Cloud
spells.description:
This spell conjures a cloud of poison, causing 3 magic damage to any creatures who remain in the target area at the end of each turn for the next 1 minute (6 rounds).

This effect can be ended with spells such as [Cure Poison] or [Dispel Magic].
spells.summary: 3 damage at the end of the target's turn.

spells.name: △Wind Foot*
spells.description: By weaving a wind that accelerates the caster's movements, they gain the upper hand. This spell must be cast during Combat Preparation, before the target attempts an Initiative check. The target receives a +2 bonus to their Initiative check.
spells.summary: Initiative check +2

spells.name: Telekinesis
spells.description:
As a Major Action, one object can be moved up to 3m per round (10 seconds). The caster can make the object float in the air but can't make it slip through obstacles. Even if multiple targets are selected with [Metamagic/Targets], only one object can be moved per Major Action.

The target object can be moved regardless of weight, but must not be taller than 2m nor larger around than 1m radius. This spell cannot affect objects held or equipped by other characters.
spells.summary: Lift and move objects

spells.name: Life Search*
spells.description: The caster knows the position of all creatures in the spell's range, their maximum HP, and their current HP value. The creatures that can be sensed must be at least large enough to be seen by the human eye.
spells.summary: Allows caster to sense creatures within radius

spells.name: Counter Magic
spells.description: Activates the target's spirit, giving them a +2 bonus to Willpower checks.
spells.summary: Willpower checks +2

spells.name: Fairy Lord
spells.description: This spell is identical to [Summon Fairy], except the duration is 10 seconds (1 round), the mako stone needs to have at least 10 MP, and the monster level of the fairy to be called is 17.
spells.summary: Calls and uses a level 17 Fairy Lord

spells.name: Beam Strike
spells.description: The Spirit of Lunoicos fires its powerful Light Ray, dealing Power 30 + Magic Power magic damage to targets in its path.
spells.summary: Deals Power 30

spells.name: Burst Gate
spells.description:
Concentrated mana radiates from the Abyss Gate.

The target takes Power 70 + Magic Power points of damage. This spell does not originate from the caster but from the Abyss Gate opened by the caster. The caster must be within 30 meters of the Abyss Gate.
spells.summary: Power 70 damage

spells.name: Wraith Form
spells.description:
The caster's consciousness breaks free from their body, taking the form of a Wraith (CR III, p. 369 or ML, p. 145). The caster's HP, MP, levels, Willpower, Fortitude, classes, and weapons skills remain the same, but they gain the Wraith's Unique Skills [〇Normal Weapon Immunity] and [〇Fog Body]. See CR III, p. 327 or ML, p. 69 for [〇Normal Weapon Immunity].

While a Wraith, the caster's body lies unconscious, and the caster cannot directly perceive using its body's senses. If the duration elapses or the caster wishes, they may return to their body regardless of distance. However, if the caster's body is destroyed or otherwise lost while in Wraith form, the spell becomes permanent, and the caster remains a Wraith, unable to return to their body.
spells.summary: Take the form of a wraith, separating mind and body

spells.name: Protection II
spells.description: The target takes -3 damage from all physical and magical sources. This spell does not affect Poison-, Disease-, or Curse-type damage.
spells.summary: Reduces target's damage by -3

spells.name: Stone Blast
spells.description: Rocky columns extrude from the earth and pummel the chosen target, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage

spells.name: †Sacred Weapon
spells.description:
This spell empowers the target to fight against impurities.

The target's melee and ranged attacks when attacking Undead or Barbarous characters receive a +1 bonus to Accuracy and deal an additional +2 physical damage. These attacks are treated as if they were made with a magic weapon, but still deals physical damage.
spells.summary: Accuracy +1 and physical damage +2 against Barbarous and Undead

spells.name: Remote Doll
spells.description:
Caster sends their senses into a doll and causes it to move about as if it were their own body. The doll can use the caster's special senses (Darkvision etc.) but none of the caster's class skills or special abilities (including Sword's Grace abilities). While the caster is acting as the doll, their own body cannot move or take Major or Minor Actions, nor can they use their own body's senses.

While controlling the doll, the caster can manipulate items and move with the efficacy of a Human child. The caster can also speak through the doll.
spells.summary: Control a doll as if it were the caster's own body

spells.name: Fine Weather*
spells.description: Instantly clears any bad weather, resulting in a clear sky no matter how bad the weather conditions were previously. There will be no rain, snow, or strong winds for the spell's duration. Clouds above the area of effect will disappear. Blue or starry skies can be seen, and the sun and moon may also appear depending on the time of day.
spells.summary: Clears the weather in the area

spells.name: Shallow Preservation
spells.description:
The caster prevents any major changes to the Shallow Abyss and seals off access to it. For the duration of the effect, it is impossible to escape from the targeted Shallow, and it is also impossible to enter it. The effect of being unable to enter or exit also applies to the caster.

When using an effect that involves teleportation, etc., this spell's success value is compared to the teleportation's success value, and only if its success value is higher than this spell's success value will the teleportation effect be applied. If this teleportation's success value is lower than this spell's success value, then none of the teleportation's effects will be applied.

To cancel the effects of this spell, you must use either [Perfect Cancellation] or a similar effect. If the caster dies or the Abyss Core of the targeted Abyss is destroyed, the effects of this spell are immediately undone.

This spell has no effect if the caster is not within the targeted Shallow.

Enhancement:

The condition for cancellation is changed to exclude "caster death," and a bonus of +10 is added to the success value of this spell.
spells.summary: Seals off access to a Shallow Abyss

spells.name: Force
spells.description: Shoots the target with a cannonball of spiritual force, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magical damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage

spells.name: ⏩Cannon Bullet
spells.description:
Produces an exceptionally powerful explosive shell. The bullet has "Target: 1 area (4m radius)/10" and "Range: 2 (20m)" (regardless of the gun the caster uses), and deals Power 40 + Magic Power magic damage when it hits the target. Only a gun with "Stance: 2H" is sturdy enough to fire this spell (bullet).

The caster can exclude themselves from the target if they are within the area of effect of the shot, even from within skirmishes. In addition, if the caster has learned the combat feat [Magic Control], they can exceptionally declare it when firing this shell to exclude any character within the shot's area of effect. This allows the caster to exclude any character within the shot's area of effect from the target.
spells.summary: Produces a shell with a Power 40 for 2H Gun only

spells.name: Automobile II
spells.description: The magisphere transforms into a Superior Manabike (see CR III, p. 262 or Epic Treasury, p. 176). It can be used as a mount immediately. While transformed, the magisphere cannot be used to cast Magitech.
spells.summary: Create a Superior Manabike

spells.name: Completed Trap*
spells.description:
The spell makes it more difficult to disarm a trap that the caster has placed.

This spell targets traps that are already in place. The target on which this spell is used cannot be disarmed by a normal Disable Device check. However, if this spell is canceled by some effect (Success Value must be compared), the trap can be disarmed normally.
spells.summary: Increases difficulty to disarm placed traps

spells.name: ⏩△Sharp Tactics*
spells.description:
This spell allows the caster to analyze the situation and turn the tides of war to their advantage.

Target receives +1 to both Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks for the duration of the spell.
spells.summary: Monster Knowledge and Initiative Check +1

spells.name: Spirit Domination*
spells.description:
The target of this spell simultaneously experiences pleasure when obeying the caster and fear when disobeying.

If the target attempts a skill check as directed by the caster during the spell's duration, they gain a +2 bonus to the check. However, if the target attempts a skill check to harm or interfere with the caster, the check receives a -2 penalty.

Wide-range effects that include the caster are also subject to bonus and penalty modifications.

When this spell is cast, 1 HP is consumed simultaneously as MP. If the spell is cast on characters in multiple sections or with [Metamagic/**], the HP consumption is doubled.
spells.summary: Action checks +2 to help the caster, -2 against

spells.name: ⏩Evil Contract
spells.description:
Renews the Daemon Contract more strongly, temporarily giving the Daemon more power.

For the duration of the effect, when the caster's Daemons act according to the "Daemon's Action Chart," they gain a +2 bonus to their success value and gain +2 to the physical and magical damage they inflict.

For the next 1 hour, Banish checks from the caster receive a -1 penalty.
spells.summary: +2 success value from "Daemon's Action Chart," +2 damage, -1 Banish check

spells.name: Hallucinogenic Spores
spells.description:
The Spirit of the Fungal Parasite sprays hallucinogenic spores. Target takes a -4 penalty on all action checks for the duration of the effect.

This spell can be cast only once a day. It is not affected by any [Metamagic/**] Combat Feats when cast.
spells.summary: Action checks -4

spells.name: Energy Bolt
spells.description: Creates and shoots an arrow of pure mana, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magical damage to the target.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage

spells.name: Signature Torch*
spells.description: A bright flame emerges near the target, illuminating them and a 5m radius around them. In Simplified Combat, only the area where the target is located will be illuminated. This bright light eliminates the penalty for poor visibility and gives the target a -2 penalty to their Evasion.
spells.summary: Marks the target with a flame, Evasion -2

spells.name: Marking
spells.description:
The caster can tell the direction and distance to the marked object at any time during the duration. The spell fades if the object is destroyed or moved from its initial location.

While this spell is in effect, the caster may not cast it a second time (the caster may not locate two objects at once with this spell).
spells.summary: Places an arcane mark upon an object

spells.name: Safety Zone
spells.description:
Creates a space within the Shallow that temporarily suppresses its effects.

The targeted space can be used for safe rest for the duration of the spell. Also, if the target rests for more than 3 hours, the amount of HP, MP, etc., recovered during the rest will be doubled (6 hours of recovery in 3 hours). The upper limit of rest-based recovery and other effects will not be increased.

In addition, characters who perform a Danger Sense Check within the range of this spell will receive +2 to their success value.

Enhancement:

Change the Spell to "Cost: MP0."
spells.summary: Secures a safe area within a Shallow Abyss

spells.name: †Sacred Field
spells.description:
A barrier forms around the target area, preventing any Barbarous or Undead from passing through. This barrier also prevents any spells or abilities from Barbarous or Undead from passing through as well.

When this spell is cast, the barrier will not form if any Barbarous or Undead is already within the area of this spell. Additionally, if this effect overlaps with the range of a [Vice Field] spell, both spells' effects end immediately.
spells.summary: Creates a barrier blocking Barbarous and Undead

spells.name: Blade Barrier
spells.description:
A cloud of whirling blades surrounds the target. At the end of the target's turn, the blades deal Power 0 + Magic Power magical damage. The damage from this spell has no Critical Value. If the target does not perform any Major Action or Minor Action on its turn, it does not suffer damage.

The target's Willpower should be rolled only once upon casting; if the caster succeeds on this roll, the barrier will persist around the target until the spell duration expires.
spells.summary: Creates magic blades around the target

spells.name: Familiar
spells.description:
Create a construct that will serve as a Familiar. See Familiars I for monster data, and Common Abilities of Familiars for information about Familiars in general.

Casting this spell takes one hour.
spells.summary: Creates a loyal and useful familiar

spells.name: Wolf's Bite
spells.description: Wolf's Spirit attacks the target. Roll 2d, and determine the physical damage to be dealt to the target using the table below.
spells.power_table:
2d Damage
2-6 Sharp claws rip through the target's flesh, but only cause shallow wounds. This attack deals Magic Power points as physical damage.
7-9 Sharp teeth tear into the target, dealing 3 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
10-12 A deep bite causes significant damage to a vital area, resulting in 6 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
spells.summary: Deals (0-6 + Magic Power) physical damage

spells.name: Stone Guard
spells.description:
A pebble floats around the target, interrupting any physical weapon or hazard. When the target suffers physical damage, it can be reduced up to 5 points. The target can choose whether or not to take this effect after being hit and determining the combined damage.

After protecting the target once, the spell ends.
spells.summary: One-time physical damage to target -5

spells.name: Death Cloud
spells.description: Creates a cursed cloud of roiling death, dealing Power 60 + Magic Power damage. If this reduces a character's HP to 0 or less, they receive a -20 penalty to their next Death Check.
spells.summary: Deals Power 60, Death Check -20

spells.name: Scape Doll
spells.description:
The caster can mark one doll at a time with a unique brand. If the caster receives any physical, fixed, or magical damage to their HP at any time while this spell is active, they may transfer that damage to the branded doll, regardless of the distance between the caster and the doll.

The caster can decide whether or not to let the target take the damage when they suffer damage. Once activated, the brand disappears, the spell's effect ends, and the doll is broken and unusable.

While this spell is in effect, the caster cannot cast this spell on other targets.
spells.summary: Transfers damage to specially marked dolls

spells.name: Levitation
spells.description: The caster floats up to 10 meters in the air. While floating, they can move as if they were on the ground, but only at the speed of a Limited Move.
spells.summary: Caster floats upon mana, hanging in midair

spells.name: Return
spells.description:
The magisphere starts floating in place and becomes a special return point for the caster. Until the spell ends, the caster will know exactly where they are relative to the return point. The magisphere at the return point will remain completely immobile.

The caster can instantly return to the return point simply by willing it as a Minor Action. Any character touching the caster or in a skirmish with the caster can, if they desire, return with the caster (the caster cannot refuse to do so).

Once this instantaneous return is performed, or if this spell is cast elsewhere to establish a new return point, the return point magisphere shatters and can never be used again. If the magisphere at the point of return is destroyed, the effect of this spell immediately ends and the caster is alerted.

Casting this spell requires 10 minutes (60 rounds).
spells.summary: Create a place to return to at any time

spells.name: Technical Trap*
spells.description:
The target can set traps more skillfully.

If the target performs a Set Trap check during the spell's duration, it gains a +4 bonus.
spells.summary: Set Trap check +4

spells.name: Flash Bomb
spells.description: Creates a non-lethal bomb which emits an intense flash of light. All those with Five Senses or Mechanical Perception must make a Willpower check or become blinded for the duration.
spells.summary: Creates a non-lethal bomb that emits an intense flash

spells.name: Geas
spells.description:
This spell imposes a curse that prohibits the target from performing a specific action. If the target breaks the prohibition, they will experience severe pain and suffer magic damage equal to Power 0 + Magic Power. If the character has multiple sections, the damage will be dealt to their Main Section or one section randomly selected from multiple Main Sections. If there are no Main Sections, a section will be randomly selected from all sections.

Important Note: the caster cannot forbid actions necessary to sustain life, such as breathing, eating, and sleeping.
spells.summary: Inflicts a Forbidding Curse

spells.name: Distraction
spells.description: Stirs the target's mind with chaotic thoughts. The target's concentration is broken. Furthermore, the target cannot cast spells for the duration (but may take any other action freely).
spells.summary: Stirs the target's mind with chaotic thoughts

spells.name: Shadow Body
spells.description: A shadow forms around the caster, preventing them from being hit by others. Caster gains a +1 bonus on Evasion rolls.
spells.summary: Evasion +1

spells.name: Virtual Toughness
spells.description:
Adds the caster's Magic Power to the target's current and maximum HP.

After the duration has passed, the maximum HP returns to its original value. The current value does not change unless it exceeds the target's original maximum HP, in which case the current value changes to the maximum HP value.

Note: Fairy Magic of the Light type has no effect on Constructs, Magitech, or Undead.
spells.summary: Temporarily increase the target's HP

spells.name: Balance Time
spells.description:
Caster casts [Slow] (11th level Truespeech spell) on one target and [Haste] (11th level Spiritualism spell) on another. If the target resists [Slow] due to their Willpower check, [Haste] also has no effect.

If either of the two characters has more than one section, the MP consumption is determined based on the one with the greater number of sections.

When this spell is cast along with [Metamagic/Targets], it can be cast as long as the total number of sections targeted with both parts is the same. Then, the character to which [Haste] is applied is selected according to the total number of sections of the character who failed to resist [Slow]. In order for [Haste] to have an effect, all sections of the character must be selected to be affected.
spells.summary: Slows down time for enemies and speeds up time for allies

spells.name: Airtight Armor
spells.description: The magisphere transforms into a protective suit that covers the target, making it utterly immune to Poison-type effects. The target also can breathe, allowing it to move freely underwater.
spells.summary: Allows target to withstand harsh environments

spells.name: Chaff Grenade
spells.description:
The magisphere emits a small missile which bursts into a cloud of refractive fragments, inhibiting interference from a distance.

Characters within the spell's area cannot be affected by "Area: Target" effects and spells. A target can be specified if the target is a position (area or coordinates) or if an effect other than "Area: Target" is used (e.g., "Area: Line" or "Area: Breakthrough").

A character inside the area of effect can specify targets both inside and outside the effected area without any restrictions.
spells.summary: Inhibits targeting within the area of effect

spells.name: Mind Link
spells.description:
The caster and target share senses and consciousness. The caster must touch the target to cast the spell, but for the remainder of the spell duration, their senses remain shared regardless of distance.

The caster and target can see and hear what each other sees and hears, and communicate messages back and forth without words. The caster and target cannot lie to one another while speaking this way, but they can omit information if desired.
spells.summary: Share senses and awareness with the target

spells.name: Blackout*
spells.description:
The target will be made drunk, causing them to lose memory for a certain period. The target will become favorable towards the caster for the next three hours. For the effect duration, the target will become cheerful as if they are drunk, will not be bothered by small things, and will be optimistic. During the effect period, if the caster attempts any requests or negotiations with the target, they will receive a +4 bonus to the Success Value on skill checks.

However, if the caster attempts any action to harm the target or takes any hostile actions or words during the effect duration, all effects will immediately be lost.

Moreover, for one year starting from the day after being affected by this spell, the target will lose the memory of the 3 hours during which the spell was cast. They will also forget the fact that the spell was cast on them. Even if others point out their actions or behavior during the lost memory period, they cannot recall it by themselves for one year.

The effect of making the target favorable for 3 hours is treated as Psychic type, and the effect of losing memory for one year is treated as a Poison type.

If it is known that the target has lost their memory due to this spell, it is possible to attempt to remove the amnesiac effect within the 1-year period through effects like [Cure Poison] by comparing Success Values.
spells.summary: The target becomes favorable towards the caster and loses the memory of this for one year

spells.name: Create Device
spells.description:
Creates a Magical Implement (see CR I, p. 176) in the hand of the caster. It can take any shape, so long as it's smaller than a two-handed weapon, but it cannot be used as a melee weapon in combat.

This spell can be used without the caster having a Magical Implement.
spells.summary: Creates a Magical Implement

spells.name: Pigeon Form*
spells.description:
The caster transforms into a pigeon, losing all original abilities and gaining the ability to fly. The movement speed of the pigeon form is 15 (Flying).

During the transformation, only checks based on Vitality, Intelligence, and Spirit can be performed using their original values. HP and MP remain the same as their original values.

While in pigeon form, no classes can be used, and the caster is only able to make squeaking sounds. All clothing, accessories, and possessions, except for minimal clothing and the caster's holy symbol, are dropped at the time of casting. (This clothing and symbol transform as part of the pigeon's form, and are restored when the spell ends.)
spells.summary: Take the form of a Pigeon

spells.name: Mana Integration
spells.description:
This spell causes mana to accumulate in the caster, creating a powerful force field.

For 3 minutes (18 rounds) after casting this spell, any physical or magical damage the caster receives is reduced by 10 points. At the same time, the caster must cast all magic with a range equal or greater than "Range: 1 (10m)" as "Range: Touch."
spells.summary: Reduces received damage by 10 points, can only cast spells on targets in close proximity

spells.name: ⏩△Big Defender/Sea Serpent
spells.description:
The Spirit of the Sea Serpent protects the target, which cannot be targeted by melee attacks, and gains a +4 bonus to Evasion checks against ranged attacks.

This is a "Symbolic Lore" spell (see Monstrous Lore p. 17).
spells.summary: Full protection against melee attacks, +4 Evasion against ranged attacks

spells.name: Sterile Tent*
spells.description:
A large tent of mana erects around the caster to prevent the outbreak of poison and disease.

Within the tent, no effects of Poison- or Disease-type can occur. Any Poison- or Disease-type effects on characters within or entering the tent are immediately canceled without the need for a Success Value comparison.

This spell also prevents any new effects from affecting targets within the tent.

Casting this spell takes one hour.
spells.summary: Poison and Disease effects do not work within the range

spells.name: †Erase Soulscar
spells.description:
Removes 1 soulscar from the target. This effect does not remove the innate soulscars of Nightmares, Alves, or Barbarous. A character who has received this spell at least once will automatically resist the second and subsequent casts. It cannot be used against the Undead.

This spell takes one day to cast.
spells.summary: Heals a soulscar from the target

spells.name: Retry*
spells.description:
Mirtabar leads the hands of the caster to prevent mistakes.

When performing a check belonging to the Technique check package (see CR I, p. 114) with a Time Required of 1 minute (6 rounds) or more, the 2d roll made during the check can be rerolled once.

This spell can only be cast once per day and automatically ends when the reroll takes effect.
spells.summary: Reroll technique checks that take more than 1 minute to complete

spells.name: Slow
spells.description:
The target's movement (for monsters, movement speed) is halved (rounded up). In Simplified Combat, a Full Move is required to move to the adjacent area, and it is not possible to move 2 areas.

In addition, the target must roll 1d at the beginning of its turn, and if the roll is 1 or 2, the target cannot take any Major Action in its turn.
spells.summary: Slows target's movements and actions

spells.name: Weak Point*
spells.description:
Caster sees through the eyes of a deity, detecting the enemy's unknown vulnerabilities.

If the target fails to resist, the critical threshold of any attack that hits it is reduced by 1 (criticals become more likely). This effect cannot reduce the critical threshold below 8.
spells.summary: Reduces Critical Threshold by -1

spells.name: Abyss Corridor
spells.description:
Creates a corridor within a Shallow Abyss for movement to other Shallows. While the created corridor appears to be about 2m in diameter visually, characters can pass through it regardless of their section count or size.

To create it, the caster must be present in a Shallow or equivalent environment and must have confirmed the existence of the destination Shallow. Knowledge of the destination Shallow's interior is not required.

When the spell is cast, characters present in the same Shallow as the caster can use the created corridor through normal means of movement, such as walking to enter the specified Shallow. The corridor journey takes about 10 minutes (60 rounds) on foot.

When the effect duration expires, only the corridor disappears, and the origin and destination Shallows are treated as independent entities.

Enhancement:

Changes the Duration to "Permanent." The connected Abysses are still treated as separate entities. If any of the Abysses disappear, the effects of this spell will be negated.
spells.summary: Create a corridor that connects Shallow Abysses

spells.name: ⏩Machina Greaves*
spells.description:
Gives the target the power of Aurmata's leg armor.

The target is immune to poor footing for the duration of the spell. Also, if the target attacks with Kick or a similar leg- or foot-based weapon, damage is increased by +2.
spells.summary: Immune to poor foothold penalty, Kick damage +2

spells.name: Call God
spells.description:
This spell calls upon the caster's deity and pleads with them for help in a time of dire need. To cast this spell, a special preparation (ritual) is needed, after which this spell must be immediately cast. The caster can cast the spell immediately after the preparation. Still, if the same time of the preparation elapses without casting the spell, the caster must start the preparation from the beginning.

This spell's MP and casting time depend upon the type of god being called. When using miraculous power in battle, the caster can wipe out any enemy within the caster's sight below the specified level (monster level, adventurer level) without any resistance.

Priests of a summoned god within its sphere of influence (see Magus Arts p. 101) will notice that this ritual was completed (regardless of where the spell itself has been cast).

Ancient God / Preparation 1 Year / Casting 7 Days / 200 MP / Affects 35 or lower Levels

Once summoned, the god can perform massive miracles, such as creating massive fissures in the continent, creating whole islands, and other miracles that vastly change the face of Raxia.

Once this spell is complete, the caster's soul leaves with their god, preventing the caster from being resurrected.

Major God / Preparation 1 Month / Casting 1 Day / 100 MP / Affects 25 or lower Levels

Once summoned, the god can perform large-scale miracles, such as leveling an entire mountain or turning the land within the caster's vision into a deep forest.

Once this spell is complete, the caster immediately dies, regardless of their current HP value.

Minor God / Preparation 6 Rounds / Casting 1 Round / 50 MP / Affects 15 or lower Levels

Once summoned, the god can perform small-scale miracles, such as moving an immense boulder or causing an entire hillside to burst into blooming flowers.

Once the spell is complete, the caster falls to 0 HP and has their Maximum MP reduced by 50 for the next seven days.
spells.summary: Call down the god the caster believes in

spells.name: Earth Hammer
spells.description:
A stone hammer appears out of the ground and strikes the target. The spell deals Power 10 + Magic Power physical damage. The critical threshold for this spell is 12.

The target character's unique skills reduce or increase the damage as if it were a magic bludgeoning weapon.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 physical damage. Critical Threshold 12

spells.name: Illusion
spells.description:
The caster creates hallucinations indistinguishable from natural objects. The only limitation of these hallucinations is size; they must fit within a 3m radius area. Hallucinations have no smell, do not make noise, and are intangible. The caster must concentrate if they wish to have the hallucinations move freely. Otherwise, they repeat simple movements up to about a minute long.

It is possible to change the appearance of a character or object, in which case the hallucinations would move with the character or object.
spells.summary: Create hallucinations

spells.name: Pessimism
spells.description:
Reminds the target of past emotional pain.

The target takes Power 10 + Magic Power Magic Damage. In addition, the target suffers -1 to Accuracy and Spellcasting Checks for the next 10 Seconds (1 round).

If this spell is cast in a Shallow Abyss or similar environment, the penalty to the Accuracy Check and Spellcasting Check will increase by -1 (for a total of -2).

 
Enhancement:

Caster gains a +2 bonus to the spell's success value.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 Damage, Accuracy and Spellcasting Check -1

spells.name: Earth Shield
spells.description: This spell increases the durability of the target's armor and body with the power of the earth, adding +2 to the target's Defense.
spells.summary: Defense +2

spells.name: △Sharp Eye/Tiger
spells.description:
Caster gains Tiger Spirit's keen eyes and movement and has the initiative in a battle.

Caster changes the Success Value of their Initiative check to 14 if the result is less than 14. No automatic failure can occur on the Initiative check, and no experience points are gained if they roll a 2.

Note: [Sharp Eye/**] affects the Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks performed during Combat Preparation. This spell may be cast after checking the results of other characters belonging to the same faction. It is generally more effective for the game to proceed smoothly by allowing players to select or discard factors that might affect Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks during Combat Preparation, not just this spell after the results of other characters are determined.
spells.summary: Guaranteed 14 Success Value on Initiative check

spells.name: Holy Light
spells.description: Unleashes a burst of divine radiance that deals Power 20 + Magic Power magical damage to Undead in the area.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage to Undead

spells.name: Rich Heal
spells.description:
Restores the HP of characters in the target area by (caster's Magic Power + 16) points.

Note: Fairy Magic of the Light type has no effect on Constructs, Magitech, or Undead.
spells.summary: Restore the target's HP by (Magic Power + 16) points

spells.name: Clean Clothes*
spells.description:
This spell removes stains from clothes and provides resistance to new stains while the clothes are worn on the body.

The target can be a piece of cloth or a garment. A single piece of fabric can be up to 5 square meters in size (e.g., a bed sheet for one adult), and a piece of clothing is sufficient to be worn by one character without difficulty.

The target is cleaned of dirt, and any tears are repaired to make it perfect. Additionally, for one day, wearing this enchanted cloth or clothing or having it directly touch the skin provides a +1 bonus to Fortitude and Willpower checks against Poison and Disease effects.
spells.summary: Removes dirt from cloth, +1 against Poison or Disease when worn

spells.name: ⏩Fall Lightning*
spells.description:
Summons a lightning cloud overhead which strikes someone within range with lightning.

The target of this effect is chosen at random from all the characters (sections) in the area, and the target is dealt Power 10 + Magic Power magic damage.

The caster can choose not to apply this effect after checking the chosen target (similar to "canceling" Aspects of the Geomancer class (see Magus Arts, p. 21)).

This effect can only be used once per round.
spells.summary: Damages random character with Power 10

spells.name: Machina Armor*
spells.description:
This spell gives the target the power of Aurmata's armored shield. While the spell is active, if the target takes physical or magical damage that reduces their HP, they immediately regain half of the reduced HP (rounded up). The target can choose whether to use this effect after being attacked and determining the applied damage. Once the effect is applied, the spell is canceled.

This effect even works if the target's HP falls to 0 or below due to damage, but the Death Check must still be performed before the target recovers from this effect. If the check succeeds, the target will be healed but will remain unconscious.

This effect cannot be applied to fixed damage.
spells.summary: Halves damage received (rounded up), HP is restored immediately

spells.name: Imitating Shadow
spells.description:
The target mimics the shadow of the specified location or person. While mimicking, the shadow mimic cannot perform any actions. The target's movement exactly follows the the shadowed subject, regardless of the mimic's own movement ability or movement speed (see p. 66). At the same time, the mimic is not subject to any effects, attacks, etc., including area of effect spells, except those that directly cancel this spell. If the shadow is surrounded by a light source from all directions, characters in the surrounding area will notice the unnatural presence of the shadow. On the other hand, if there is no light source at all, the shadow can maintain its mimicry.

If the abnormality of the shadow is detected during the mimicry, a Detect Check is performed against the Success Value of this spell. If the result is in favor of the suspicious party, they will realize that the shadow is not natural. Depending on the situation, the GM may have the owner of the shadow or other suspicious characters perform a Danger Sense Check or Notice Check.

At any point of the duration of the mimicry effect, the mimic may cancel this spell at will. After the illusion has been lifted, the mimic can immediately perform actions. If the mimic intends to attack, the spell can be released while in combat preparation or as a Minor Action. At this time, the owner of the shadow must make a Danger Sense check, and if they fail, they suffer -2 to Evasion against the incoming attack.

In the case of a shadow mimic engaging the shadow owner in one-on-one combat, the shadow owner's failure of the Danger Sense check is treated as being in an ambush (see CR I, p. 144).
spells.summary: Target mimics a shadow

spells.name: Wind Voice
spells.description: The caster can listen to sounds and transmit their voice within the spell's range. The area must be within the caster's line of sight and outdoors.
spells.summary: Allows to hear sounds and be heard in the target range

spells.name: Neutralize
spells.description: Within the target area, all Fire-, Water/Ice-, Earth-, or Wind-type effects are negated, and spells and unique skills of those types cannot be used. This applies even if the source of the effect is outside the targeted area and casting into the range of this spell. All four effect types are suppressed at the same time.
spells.summary: Suppresses the 4 classical elemental types in the area

spells.name: Strong Drink*
spells.description:
Turns water or other liquids into poor-quality alcohol. The target liquid must be something the caster can touch directly and must be a contiguous volume of up to 10 liters.

Poisons or drugs in the liquid can also be targeted, but in such cases, a comparison of Success Values is necessary.

For every liter of this alcohol consumed, a Fortitude check must be made against the Success Value at the time of creation. If failed, the drinker receives a -1 penalty to action checks for 6 hours after consumption. This effect is cumulative (up to a maximum of -4). This effect is Poison type.
spells.summary: Turn liquid into strong, poor-quality alcohol

spells.name: ⏩Timer Clock
spells.description:
When a caster casts any [… Bomb] spell, they can add a delay before it goes off. The caster must cast the [Timer Clock] spell immediately before casting the [Bomb] spell. This delay time can be set from 10 seconds (1 round) to 1 hour, in increments of 10 seconds.

If the caster wishes, and if the delay is greater than 1 minute, the bomb can emit a warning sound 1 minute (6 rounds) before detonation.
spells.summary: Changes [… Bomb] spell duration

spells.name: Instant Abyssal Zone
spells.description:
Fills the target space with thick miasma.

For the duration of the effect, the target space will be treated as a Shallow Abyss or similar environment. At the same time, it will be treated as a space that is not a natural environment and where sunlight does not reach.

This effect does not restrict physical movement or create an Abyss Core.

This effect is treated in the same way as the [Abyssal Zone] effect.

Enhancement:

This spell can be cast using a Minor Action or during Combat Preparation.
spells.summary: Creates an environment similar to a Shallow Abyss temporarily

spells.name: Burning Soul*
spells.description:
The caster's body is covered with fire (which is harmless to the caster).

Whenever the caster receives one or more points of physical or magical damage from a melee attack, the attacker immediately takes 5 Fire magic damage.
spells.summary: Covers the caster in a fiery shield

spells.name: Fairy Wish II
spells.description: Same as [Fairy Wish], except the bonus granted is increased to +2, and the duration is 6 hours.
spells.summary: Caster requests strong Fairies, and they guide their decisions

spells.name: Weather Forecast*
spells.description:
The target will more precisely monitor the weather around it.

If the target performs a Meteorology check within the spell's duration, it gains a +4 bonus.
spells.summary: Meteorology check +4

spells.name: Cold Rain*
spells.description: The skies dump a torrent of cold rain within the spell's range, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magic damage. If the target fails its Willpower check against this spell, it suffers a -1 penalty to Evasion checks for 10 seconds (1 round).
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage, Evasion -1
spells.divinity: Furusil, Goddess of Wind and Rain

spells.name: Surrounding Attackers
spells.description:
While under the effect of this spell, the target is haunted by the Spirit of the Giant Gadfly, rendering it unable to defend itself.

The target receives a -1 penalty on Evasion checks. Once the target fails an Evasion check, this spell ends.
spells.summary: Target's Evasion check -1 (until next failure)

spells.name: Change Fraud*
spells.description:
Gain is achieved by distracting the target or temporarily diluting the target's interest in money.

Target will not notice an error of a fractional amount less than 5% (1/20) of the total amount when conducting money transactions such as trading for the duration of this spell.

Exceptionally, this spell does not require vocalization to be cast. Also, if the target fails to resist this spell, it is unaware that this spell has been cast.
spells.summary: Target will not notice price over/under by less than 5%

spells.name: Raging Earth II
spells.description: Each character in the target area regenerates 10 points of damage at the end of their turn. This even heals creatures of the Undead, Magitech, and Construct categories.
spells.summary: Heals 10 points per round

spells.name: Hide in Nature*
spells.description:
While in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101), the caster blends into the terrain, becoming less visible.

For as long as the caster remains in a natural environment, all Accuracy checks and Spellcasting checks performed with or including the caster as a target will incur a penalty of -1 to the success value. This effect occurs even for Area: Line effects. If the caster is explicitly excluded from the target by [Magic Control], this effect will not occur.

Additionally, if the caster makes a Hide check in a natural environment, they gain a +4 bonus.
spells.summary: Less visible in the natural environment

spells.name: Icicle Weapon
spells.description: When the target makes a melee or ranged attack, the weapon used in the attack is treated as a Water/Ice magic weapon, and the physical damage it causes is increased by +3.
spells.summary: Attacks deal Water/Ice damage with +3 bonus

spells.name: Dispel Magic
spells.description: Removes one effect of magic (other than Curse type) if your Spellcasting success value for this spell is greater than the target spell's Spellcasting success value. See Magus Arts, p. 72 for detailed rules on removing spell effects.
spells.summary: Makes the spell lose its effect

spells.name: Poison Spread
spells.description: Poisonous Spillbug's Spirit sprays poison fluid and deals Power 10 + Magic Power magic damage to the target.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 over area

spells.name: Machine Repair
spells.description:
The caster can repair any item or structure built during the Magitech Civilization Period or later that has at least 70% of its original parts intact.

One magisphere (Large) will repair something around the average size of a human, two magispheres can repair objects the size of a hut, and three magispheres will repair anything the size of a small fort or smaller. The magispheres don't need to be equipped to be used for this spell.

This spell can repair Runefolk bodies as well as Magitech characters. This restores the appearance and function of the character. However, it does not restore any HP or raise the dead. Magispheres used for this purpose will be lost.

This spell takes 1 hour to cast.
spells.summary: Repairs tools and equipment

spells.name: Dancing Flame*
spells.description:
By entwining fire around an equipped weapon and swinging it as if dancing, the caster creates a storm of fire.

The weapon deals magic damage to the target equal to the power of the equipped weapon + Magic Power. If the caster has multiple equipped weapons or a weapon with multiple power tables, they can choose any one of them. The Critical Threshold of this magic corresponds to the chosen attack method. If the chosen attack is not feasible (e.g., selecting the power of "Stance: 2H" requires the caster to meet the minimum strength requirement and hold the weapon with both hands), they cannot choose that attack method. Additionally, any special effects of the weapon do not apply (for instance, even if they choose "Throw", the opponent will not be knocked down).

Exceptionally, even if the caster has not mastered the Combat Feat [Magic Control], they can exclude any target within range as if they had mastered it.
spells.summary: Casts the damage of the equipped weapon to a wide area

spells.name: Daemon Swap
spells.description:
Sends the summoned Daemon back to the Abyss Gate and summons a new Daemon immediately. This spell summons a new Daemon to the same location (area, coordinates) as the Abyss Gate that the caster themselves opened. This spell can only be used if the caster is in the same location (area, coordinates) as the Abyss Gate that they opened themselves.

Banish Tribute is not required to summon a Daemon by this spell, and no check is needed to summon a Daemon. However, the MP that was expended at the time of summoning will not be refunded.

A new Daemon must be summoned, and it must be exactly one level higher than the Daemon being banished. In this case, no Summoning Sacrifice is required for the Daemon to be summoned, and no MP must be expended for the summoning (besides the MP7 required to cast this spell).

The effect of this spell is an exception: it can summon Daemons up to the caster's Adventurer Level + 1.

The banishment of Daemons summoned by the effect of this spell will follow the normal process, but the caster will not receive any MP back, even if the Daemon is not exorcised.
spells.summary: Returns summoned Daemon to Abyss Gate and summons a new one

spells.name: Tongues
spells.description:
During the spell's duration, the caster can speak and understand any one selected language as though they were fluent in it. The target language is chosen during the spell's casting. Even if the caster does not know the name of the language, they can choose it by listening to words spoken in that language and identifying the language name at the same time.

To read a selected language, see the [Translate] spell.
spells.summary: Speak and understand an unknown language

spells.name: Air Walk*
spells.description:
Target will be able to move through the air without moving their feet.

The target's Normal Move will be either their original speed or 10, whichever is lower. It will not be possible to move except by the effect of this spell (e.g., using one's legs or other similar modes of movement).

There are no restrictions on aerial movement.

This spell's effect does not apply in Simplified Combat.
spells.summary: Allows target to walk on air

spells.name: Kong Smash
spells.description: Forest Kong's Spirit swings its fist at the target. Roll 2d and determine the physical damage to be dealt to the target using the table below.
spells.power_table:
2d Damage
2-6 Only a scrape. This attack deals 12 + Magic Power points as physical damage.
7-9 A decent hit. This attack deals 15 + Magic Power points as physical damage.
10-12 A huge hit, resulting in 18 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
spells.summary: Deals (12-18 + Magic Power) physical damage

spells.name: Quick Resurrection
spells.description:
Revives a corpse immediately. The Target Number is the number of days elapsed since death. The Soulscar Table (see CR I, p. 186) should also be used as in the case of [Resurrection] (see CR II, p. 135), but the roll is modified with +10.

If the revival succeeds, the target awakens with 1HP (for all sections if the target has multiple sections), and the MP is kept as it was just before the death. All the spells and effects the target was under before the death are removed.

A target whose soulscar has reached 5 due to using the soulscar table is revived as a Revenant (see CR I, p. 416). This Revenant revives with its maximum HP and attacks the caster who casts this spell as the first priority. After the caster is defeated, the Revenant kills and destroys indiscriminately.

Generally, only a limited number of beings with unresolved feelings for the world will allow themselves to be resurrected. If the target is a PC, it is up to the player's decision. The GM should decide on other Humanoids, Barbarous, Animals, Plants, and Mythical Beasts. Undead, Constructs, Magitech (except Runefolk), Fairies, and Daemons cannot be revived under any circumstances.
spells.summary: Raise the dead instantly; soulscar table rolled with +10

spells.name: Money Distraction*
spells.description:
The target's financial sense and perception of important matters in business dealings will be distorted. They will start to prioritize trivial matters in business dealings and disregard important matters, persons, and pledges.

As a result, the target is unable to close any business transactions during the time of effect.
spells.summary: Distrustful of monetary transactions

spells.name: Nap
spells.description:
The target falls into a light sleep. It cannot move or perform any active actions. If a passive action check is requested, the target receives a -4 penalty. A standing target will not fall prone, but sleeps while standing.

The effect of this spell is automatically canceled when another character touches the target. If it is a friendly character, it can be canceled with Minor Action.
spells.summary: Puts target to sleep

spells.name: Reboot*
spells.description:
The caster entrusts the target with its thoughts.

The target will have its number of Major Actions increased by one on the first turn within the spell's duration after this spell is cast. This effect is automatically lost once the action is taken.
spells.summary: Increase the target's Major Actions by one

spells.name: ⏩△Daemon's Tax
spells.description:
When the caster takes damage, a curse is inflicted upon the attacker.

If the caster takes physical or magical damage from a melee or ranged attack for the duration of the spell, this curse inflicts damage equal to the Warlock's class level back on the attacker.

This effect is lost once activated.
spells.summary: Returns a portion of the damage taken by caster

spells.name: Blood Mist
spells.description:
The caster injures themselves, causing their blood (or similar bodily fluid) to spray out as poison.

Characters within the area suffer a -2 penalty to Accuracy Checks and Evasion Checks for the duration of the effect. If this spell is multiplied by [Metamagic/**], HP consumption is doubled as well.
spells.summary: Accuracy and Evasion Checks -2

spells.name: Noisy Disturbance
spells.description:
Noisy Rattlesnake's Spirit creates a noise which disturbs concentration. Characters within the target area suffer a -4 penalty on Spellcasting and Performance checks. A character who cannot hear at the time of the casting spell is not affected.

This spell can be cast only once a day. It is not affected by any [Metamagic/**] Combat Feats when cast.
spells.summary: Spellcasting and Performance checks -4

spells.name: Cure Heart
spells.description: Heals Power 30 + Magic Power damage. This spell does not affect Constructs or Magitech. If the target is Undead, this spell deals Power 30 + Magic Power damage instead.
spells.summary: Heal target's wounds with Power 30

spells.name: Cornucopia*
spells.description:
In the hand of the caster, a goat horn appears.

The created goat horn can produce any food desired by the caster indefinitely for the duration of the effect. This food can be eaten as usual for the duration of the spell.

The food can be eaten by anyone, and any character who eats gains a +3 bonus to Fortitude and Willpower checks and Death Checks for the duration of the spell.

Food that is produced but not eaten vanishes when the spell ends. The check bonuses are similarly lost, but food already eaten remains filling and nourishing.
spells.summary: Create goat horn that produces endless food

spells.name: Seal Enchantment
spells.description:
The target can no longer be detected by any spell ([Sense Magic], [Mana Search], etc.) or ability that detects magic, and its magical effects on it are hidden.

This spell has no significance when appraising an item by Appraise check. However, often items with this spell are disguised as non-magical items, and in such cases, the knowledge-based appraisal of the treasure will also be harder to do (higher target number).
spells.summary: Hides the magic of an object

spells.name: ⏩△Another's Knowledge
spells.description:
Each time this spell is cast, the caster may perform a skill check using the standard value of their Summoning Arts' Magic Power to gain knowledge of the Otherworld or Daemons. The effect ends after one check. This is handled in the same way as an Insight Check by the Sage Class. The GM decides whether or not the subject of this check is related to the Otherworld. The same thing or monster may only be checked once per day by this spell.

You may also use this spell to make a Monster Knowledge check. In that case, use the following guidelines:

The caster will automatically learn whether the target monster is a Daemon or not. In case the monster was previously misidentified, the caster will learn that at this stage. If the target is in fact a Daemon, the Warlock can make a Monster Knowledge check using their Summoning Arts Magic Power. If the Success Value is higher than the target's weakness value, the target's weakness will also be discovered; however, this weakness cannot be exploited solely by using this spell.

Note that the caster cannot correctly detect Daemons if a monster is transformed using [Shapeshift] or similar abilities. For such cases, it is necessary to first identify the monster with a Detect Check or other means, or the result will remain false.
spells.summary: Gain Daemonic Knowledge

spells.name: Sphere Shed
spells.description:
A single inanimate object no larger than 1m radius and 2m tall is stored inside a magisphere. Only one item can be stored per magisphere, and living things and corpses cannot be stored. Stored items don't increase the size or weight of the magisphere.

A magisphere with an object in it cannot be used to cast Magitech.

The stored object can be retrieved via a spoken password (not necessarily spoken by the caster), and the spell will end. This password can be any word in any language, or even just nonsensical sounds. While casting this spell, the password is set in a way that cannot be overheard by nearby characters.
spells.summary: Store tools and equipment in magispheres

spells.name: ⏩Element Bullet
spells.description: A bullet empowered by this spell deals Power 20 + Magic Power magic damage if it hits. In addition, the bullet deals elemental attribute damage. The caster may choose between Fire, Water/Ice, Wind, Earth, or Lightning as the elemental type at the time of casting.
spells.summary: Creates Power 20 bullet with elemental type

spells.name: Detect True Coin*
spells.description:
This spell targets a single bundle of gamel coins containing 1,000 gamels or less.

The spell correctly identifies the number of legal gamel coins within the target coinage, whether gold or silver. It can also determine the authenticity of the coins, including the mixing ratio of metals, differences in minting techniques and designs, and more.

When the caster performs this spell on a certain amount of gamel coins, they will know how many of them are genuine gamel coins. It is also possible to distinguish between real and fake coins.
spells.summary: Determines the authenticity of a coin

spells.name: Evangel*
spells.description:
The power of the sun's rays attempts to remove all Poison-, Disease-, Curse-, and Psychic-type effects on the target. For each effect, a contested check is needed.

This spell can only be cast in direct sunlight or while within the range of the [Daybreak] spell. In that case, the [Daybreak] spell ends immediately after this spell is cast.
spells.summary: Removes Poison-, Disease-, Curse-, and Psychic-type effects

spells.name: ⏩△Blink
spells.description: The caster automatically succeeds the next Evasion check they need to make. This effect automatically occurs the first time an Evasion check is requested. After this first check, this spell is automatically canceled.
spells.summary: Creates an afterimage to take an attack instead

spells.name: War Spirit*
spells.description:
Boosts morale around the caster and improves combat abilities.

Targets within the area of effect gain a +1 bonus to Accuracy, Evasion, Fortitude, and Willpower. The caster can select who will be affected by this spell within the target radius.
spells.summary: Accuracy, Evasion, Fortitude, and Willpower +1

spells.name: Nature's Reprisal
spells.description:
This spell only affects Undead and Daemon characters.

The great force of nature oppresses any being that opposes it. The target receives a -2 penalty to the Success Value of any action checks (including the use of unique skills).

This spell can also be cast with MP Cost: 21, in which case its Resistance becomes Temporary.
spells.summary: Undead and Daemon action checks -2

spells.name: Pack Camouflage
spells.description:
The target of this spell blends naturally with its surroundings, making it difficult to recognize.

When casting the spell, note the Success Value of the Spellcasting check. If the target attempts to Hide within the spell's duration, its Hide Success Value can be replaced with the Success Value of the caster's earlier recorded Spellcasting check. If the target has any bonus or penalty modifications to the Hide check, they are applied to the spell's Success Value.

This effect can only be applied when the target is in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101).
spells.summary: Creates camouflage to hide in nature

spells.name: Daemon Buster*
spells.description:
A pillar of divine light bursts down on the target's head.

If the target is a Daemon, the spell deals Power 70 + Magic Power magic damage. In addition, for the next 10 seconds (1 round), any physical damage and magic damage caused by the target is reduced by 5 points.
spells.summary: Power 70 damage to a Daemon and -5 to the damage it deals

spells.name: ⏩△Daemon's Dodge
spells.description:
Temporarily imbues the Warlock with the quickness and agility of a Daemon.

For the duration of the effect, the standard value for the caster's Evasion checks is Warlock Level + Agility Modifier.
spells.summary: Can make Evasion checks with (Warlock Level + Agility Modifier)

spells.name: Save the World
spells.description:
A hemispherical barrier forms at the edge of the targeted area, protecting it from any outside influences or interference. No spell or unique skill can pass through. If the character is standing on the edge of a barrier at the moment of the cast of this spell, they can decide where they want to be (outside or inside).

This barrier cannot be broken or removed by any means, physical, magical, or otherwise, even by spells like [Perfect Cancellation]. However, the caster must concentrate for the spell's entire duration to maintain the effect. If the caster moves or takes a Major or Minor Action, the effect dissipates, and the barrier disappears.
spells.summary: Reflects magic spells to the caster

spells.name: Giant Kick
spells.description:
An earthen foot appears out of the ground and kicks the target. This attack deals Power 50 + Magic Power physical damage. The critical threshold for this spell is 12. The damage is reduced or increased by the target character's unique skills, as if this spell's damage were a magic blunt weapon.

A character with only one section rolls 1d and falls prone on a roll of 1-3. Characters with multiple sections will only make this roll when targeted with [Metamagic/Targets] combat feat (if even one section is not affected, it will not fall prone).
spells.summary: Deals Power 50 damage and makes fall prone

spells.name: Flashlight
spells.description:
The magisphere emits a light which illuminates a 10m radius in front of it. Within the light, all penalties from darkness are canceled.

In Simplified Combat, two areas are illuminated: the area of the caster and the adjacent area in front of the caster. If the caster has advanced to the enemy's rear area, only that one area will be illuminated.
spells.summary: Illuminates a space of 2 areas (semicircle with a radius of 10m)

spells.name: Effect Protector
spells.description:
The magisphere transforms into a barrier generator that protects the caster. The next time the caster becomes the target of a spell or unique skill with "Resistance: Can't," the caster is unaffected by that spell or ability.

If a spell or ability is canceled by this spell, the magisphere used for this spell crumbles into dust, and the spell's effect immediately ends. If the spell's duration expires without taking effect, or if the caster's Willpower roll cancels the spell, the magisphere will not be destroyed.
spells.summary: Creates a barrier to protect from the special effects

spells.name: Mind Sending*
spells.description: For the spell's duration, the caster can transfer their thoughts to the target's mind using a Minor Action. The caster is limited to sending what they could say in ten seconds or a general impression of their intentions. If verbal communication is chosen, the target must be able to understand the words. The communication is one-way, from the caster to the target only. The caster cannot determine whether their intention or words were properly conveyed to the target or not.
spells.summary: Sends the caster's thoughts to the target

spells.name: Chaos Bomb
spells.description: Condensed fairy energy explodes, dealing Power 30 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 30 damage

spells.name: Forest Path*
spells.description:
Spell temporarily gives the caster the vitality of the great earth.

As long as the caster is in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101) during the duration of the effect, their maximum HP value is increased by 3 points. The current HP value is also increased (recovered) by 3 points.

If the caster leaves a natural environment during the duration of the effect, the spell is immediately canceled. Once the spell ends, if the caster's current HP value is greater than their normal maximum, the current HP value is reduced to the maximum HP value.
spells.summary: Maximum HP +3 in the natural environment

spells.name: Send from Abyss
spells.description:
If the target is in a Shallow Abyss or similar environment, they will be displaced to a location outside of it or outside of its area of influence. The displacement can be to somewhere just outside the Shallow, or to a point outside of the area of influence that is closest to where the spell was cast.

This effect cannot target the caster himself. If an object is targeted, it must be within a cube of 1 meter in size. A character who has been ejected from a Shallow by this effect will not be able to re-enter that Shallow (or an equivalent area).

Enhancement 1:

Ignores the effect of not being able to enter again, and allows the target to reenter the Shallow Abyss from which they have been ejected.

Enhancement 2:
