Removes the limitation that the caster cannot be the target of the spell, and allows the caster to select themselves as the target of the spell.
spells.summary: Ejects another person out of the Shallow Abyss

spells.name: Hard Water
spells.description: The target will be able to stand on the surface of any body of water and move around as if they were standing on the ground. Rough seas may require a Movement or Agility skill check to stay standing, at the GM's discretion.
spells.summary: The target can walk on water

spells.name: ⏩△Nature Master
spells.description:
When casting this spell, the caster can perform an action check to gain knowledge of nature, flora, and fauna using Nature Magic at Standard Value. The effect disappears after one check and is handled similarly to the Insight check by the Sage class. The GM decides if the action is related to nature or not. This spell can only check the same item or monster once a day.

This effect can also be used to perform a Monster Knowledge check. However, if some monsters are shapeshifted by their abilities, detecting them is impossible. In such cases, it is necessary to first detect the anomaly using a Detect check or other means. Otherwise, the monster will be misidentified. The target monster is automatically identified as an Animal, Plant, or Other. In case of misidentification, the caster will instead receive the shapeshifted classification.

If the target is an Animal or Plant, the Druid can make a Monster Knowledge check with the Magic Power of their Nature Magic at Standard Value. If the Success Value is greater than or equal to the monster's weakness, its weak point can be applied. However, the caster cannot get the effect of [Weakness Exploit].

Note: [Nature Master] affects the Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks performed during Combat Preparation. This spell may be cast after checking the results of other characters belonging to the same faction. It is generally more effective for the game to proceed smoothly by allowing players to select or discard factors that might affect Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks during Combat Preparation, not just this spell after the results of other characters are determined.
spells.summary: Gain knowledge about nature

spells.name: Star Guide*
spells.description:
A shooting star in the sky indicates the exact distance and direction to the nearest temple of Harula from the caster's current location.

This effect is only useful at night and when the starry sky is visible.
spells.summary: Know the location of the nearest temple by shooting stars

spells.name: Magician
spells.description:
The target learns one of the following combat feats: [Targeting], [Magic Convergence], [Magic Control], [Hawk Eye], [Violentcast I], or [MP Save/**]. The caster decides which combat feat is acquired. The target must satisfy the prerequisites for learning the feat.

With multiple castings, the caster can emulate multiple feats. If more than one [Magician] is cast, one target can be given multiple combat feats.
spells.summary: Target temporarily learns advanced magical feats

spells.name: Flame Geyser
spells.description: For the duration of the spell, the area of effect explodes with fire. At the start of any character's turn within the area of the spell, roll 1d. On 1-3, the character is struck by a gout of fire from the ground and takes Power 20 + Magic Power fire magic damage. This spell cannot crit.
spells.summary: Creates a burst of flame (Power 20)

spells.name: ⏩△Double Indicate
spells.description: The caster can issue the same "Obey Command" (see Magus Arts, p. 87) to two Golems or Undead simultaneously, even if they are different types. Both targets should be given the same command.
spells.summary: Control two Golems or Undead at the same time

spells.name: Sound Pocket
spells.description:
Any sound or voice directly caused by the target becomes inaudible to others. At the same time, the target will not be able to hear any sounds or voices from anyone other than itself.

The target is treated as being deaf (see CR II, p. 71). On the other hand, if the target is within the effect of a sound or voice-based ability such as a Spellsong, it will be immune to it. For Finales, the target gains a +4 bonus to the resistance check.

This effect does not interfere with the vocalization required for casting spells.
spells.summary: Block sound from the target

spells.name: Escape
spells.description: The target immediately teleports to the closest temple of the god that the caster believes in. This spell ignores any sort of walls, barriers, etc.
spells.summary: Call on the divine to get the target out of trouble

spells.name: Vampiric Weapon*
spells.description: When the target makes a melee attack, the weapon used is treated as a Curse-type magic weapon that deals physical damage. If the target deals physical damage to another character with this weapon during the effect's duration, the target can regain HP equal to the amount of damage dealt.
spells.summary: Weapon deals Curse damage and regains HP dealt once
spells.divinity: Zeides, Immortal Queen or Nivaceps, Blood-bathing Goddess

spells.name: Life Support
spells.description:
Halves the damage applied to the target's HP (rounded up) for the duration of the effect. This spell will even affect targets with HP 0 or less.

Note: Fairy Magic of the Light type has no effect on Constructs, Magitech, or Undead.
spells.summary: Reduces the risk of fatal injuries

spells.name: Hollow Tree Gate
spells.description:
This spell can only be cast on a large tree with a diameter of 1 meter or more. The spell creates a hollow on the tree's trunk that can be used to travel from tree to tree. This does not harm the tree.

When the caster first uses this spell, the targeted tree becomes the first exit with a hollow of a size proportional to the tree's diameter. The second tree targeted by the spell becomes an entrance to the first exit. This creates a one-way path from the second tree to the first.

Subsequently, if the caster targets a third tree, the spell on the first tree is canceled, and the second tree becomes the new exit. The third tree becomes the new entrance. Characters can now move from the third tree to the second tree.

The process can be repeated as often as the caster desires. A newly affected tree becomes the entrance, the previous entrance becomes the exit, and the old exit disappears. Thus, there is always a one-way path from the latest cast target to the previous one.

If either the entrance or the exit tree is cut down or the spell on it is lifted, the spell on the other tree ends automatically. The caster must start over by casting a spell on the first tree.
spells.summary: Create gates that allow movement from tree to tree

spells.name: Physical Gimmick
spells.description:
Creates a replacement organ (eye, ear, etc.) to replace damaged/missing ones. This replacement will work exactly the same as the original, but the body needs 1 week to adjust. A -2 penalty applies to all checks and actions that use the replacement during that time. This replacement organ will detect as magical with [Sense Magic], can be dispelled with [Dispel Magic], etc.

Only one organ can be replaced per character (in the case of a multi-section character, one organ can be replaced per section).
spells.summary: Magically repair missing body parts

spells.name: Life Signal
spells.description:
The magisphere transforms into a signal receiver. Once this spell is cast, the caster will always know the target's location (distance and directions in all three dimensions) and current HP for the duration of the spell, no matter how far away the target is. It also senses if the target is affected by a Poison-type or Disease-type effect.

The caster will not know what the target is doing or whether it has received effects other than Poison- or Disease-types.

This spell cannot be cast on undead, construct, or Magitech characters.
spells.summary: Keeps track of the target's whereabouts and health status

spells.name: Counter Sense
spells.description:
For the duration of this spell, whenever the caster is the target of a spell, he knows the name and effect of that spell and the location of that spell's caster.

Once a spell has been detected, this spell ends.
spells.summary: Wraps the caster in an aura that reacts to spells

spells.name: Chaos Blast
spells.description: Emits a burst of condensed fairy energy, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power magic damage to all characters in the area.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage

spells.name: Blizzard
spells.description: Creates a localized snowstorm dealing Power 30 + Magic Power of magical damage to up to 20 targets within the affected area.
spells.summary: Deals Power 30 damage

spells.name: Wind Circulation*
spells.description:
Generates a gentle breeze of suitable temperature within the area of effect for the duration of the spell. Within the area of effect, any penalty due to temperature or wind, including hot and cold, is reduced by 1 point. Within the area, characters can be comfortable indoors or outdoors without need of special clothing.

In addition, the rate of plant growth is doubled in the range.
spells.summary: Generates a gentle breeze that keeps the temperature to an appropriate level
spells.divinity: Furusil, Goddess of Wind and Rain

spells.name: Hidden Stranger*
spells.description:
The moving target blends in with the flowing wind and surrounding structures, making them difficult to perceive.

The target is unnoticeable to surrounding characters while moving with Normal Move, unless it makes a conspicuous action or utterance. Additionally, the target gains +2 to Hide checks during the spell's duration.

The spell immediately ends if the target performs any remarkable action. This includes any Major Action or Minor Action other than movement, or if the target vocalizes or makes a loud motion.

If another character is on guard or in a situation where the target is clearly not expected to be there, compare the target's Hide check with the alert character's Danger Sense check. If the target is noticed, the effect of this spell is immediately canceled.
spells.summary: Hide check for moving target +2

spells.name: Ring Protection
spells.description:
A number of stones float and spin in a circle around the target. These stones interrupt and stop weapons and other hazards.

When the target receives physical damage, it can be reduced by up to 5 points. This effect is available only once per round. The target can choose whether to take the effect after actually being attacked and determining the total damage.
spells.summary: Spinning stone protects the target

spells.name: Revenge Trigger*
spells.description:
The caster creates a simple trap on their body.

If the caster receives physical or magical damage during the spell's duration and their HP is reduced by more than 10 points, the target that dealt damage receives fixed damage equal to the caster's Priest class level with "Resistance: Can't." The target must be visible to the caster, but distance is not a factor.

Once this effect is used, it is lost.
spells.summary: Deals (Priest Class level) damage to anyone that deals damage to the caster

spells.name: Venom Breath
spells.description:
Sprays a mist of poison from the caster's mouth or hand.

The target takes Power 10 + Magic Power Poison-type magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage

spells.name: Light Trapper
spells.description: The Spirit of Green Cemetery emits a green light that deceives and lures its viewers. The characters affected by this effect must choose Normal Move on their turn to go toward the position (area, coordinate) from which this spell originates. The target can also choose any action that can be performed during Normal Move. If the target's position (area, coordinate) is already the same as the spell's starting position, or if the target is in a skirmish or melee, they are not affected by this spell.
spells.summary: Creates eerie light which lures targets

spells.name: ⏩△Big Defender/Roc
spells.description:
Roc's Spirit protects the target, which cannot be the target of melee or ranged attacks.

This is a "Symbolic Lore" spell (see Monstrous Lore p. 17).
spells.summary: Full protection against melee and ranged attacks

spells.name: †Banish
spells.description:
Impacts the soul of any soulscarred creature.

For each Undead or Barbarous in the area that fails to resist, roll 2d6 and consult the "Banish/Fear Table" below to determine Banish's effect. This spell is Psychic type if the target is Barbarous.
spells.power_table:
2d Effect
2-4 The target panics and goes berserk. For 30 seconds (3 rounds), it receives a +2 bonus for Accuracy and a -2 penalty for Evasion. If the target has an Intelligence score, it cannot use any actions that require reason or cast any spells.
5-9 The target is consumed by fear, slowing its movements. For 3 minutes (18 rounds), it receives a -1 penalty on all Accuracy, Evasion, and Spellcasting checks.
10-12 The target flees (or, in the case of a skirmish, uses a retreat action). If it cannot flee, it cowers in fear, cannot take any actions for ten seconds (1 round), and automatically fails all action checks. After one round, it can act normally again.
spells.summary: Negatively affects Undead and Barbarous

spells.name: Meteor Strike
spells.description:
Calls a meteor from the sky, dealing Power 100 + Magic Power of magical damage. The caster and target must both be beneath open sky for this spell to succeed.

The caster can spend an hour casting this spell. In doing so, the effects change to "Range: 2 (1km)" and "Target: All areas (500m radius)/All" as swarms of meteors devastate the target area. This version of the spell deals damage to structures and buildings as well. The buildings' Defense is ignored when dealing damage, and this spell crits on 8 or higher against buildings.
spells.summary: Deals Power 100 damage. Can be used to damage large areas

spells.name: Weapon Mastery
spells.description:
The target gains the use of one of the following Combat Feats: [Dodge], [Targeting], [Weapon Proficiency A/**], [Dual Wielding], [Repeated Strike I], [Aimed Attack I], [Power Strike I], [Taunting Strike I], [Lethal Strike I], or [Armor Piercer I].

The effects of this spell exceptionally can be duplicated. By casting the spell repeatedly, the caster can enable a target to use multiple feats.
spells.summary: The target instantly understands how to use its weapon and wields it like a master

spells.name: Floating Eye
spells.description:
The caster creates a softball-sized eye that floats in the air. This eyeball can be moved at will by the caster at a speed of 30 meters per 10 seconds (1 round).

The caster can see the scene through the eyeball as if they were seeing it themselves. However, while the spell is in effect, the caster's normal vision does not work.

The eyeball is automatically destroyed if it is attacked. At this time, the spell also ends.
spells.summary: Creates a floating eye to scout

spells.name: Far Command*
spells.description:
The caster's Stratagems will reach farther and more accurately.

For the duration of the spell, if the caster uses a Strategem of the Tactician class, the Adventurer Rank is assumed to be one level higher for the range determination. This effect does not change the caster's actual Adventurer Rank.
spells.summary: Extend the range of Stratagems used by the caster

spells.name: Hard Lock
spells.description:
Caster locks any object that can be locked, without the need for its key or other unlocking device. The target object must have a functional locking mechanism.

The original key or Disable Device skill cannot unlock the affected object. Furthermore, an affected door, lid, or box cannot be broken by any mundane means.

If a Key of Unlocking or the [Unlock] spell is used to open the affected object, make a contested roll.

The caster may set a password to lock and unlock the affected object.
spells.summary: Locks an object with magic

spells.name: Guard Trading*
spells.description:
This spell ensures that trading involving the caster is conducted fairly. If the caster performs a monetary transaction while the spell is in effect, they will immediately detect if the other party is attempting a fraudulent transaction, regardless of whether the target is aware of it or not.

Additionally, any attempt to steal or take something from the caster will be immediately exposed.

For the duration of the spell, the caster's own attempts to make an illegal transaction (whether they are aware of it or not) will also be exposed to the other party if the caster is visible to them.
spells.summary: Protecting caster's trading

spells.name: Command Doll
spells.description:
Caster animates a doll or stuffed toy and gives it an order or task.

The affected object will only carry out the order it is given. Once its task is complete or one day has passed, it reverts to an ordinary doll. The doll can execute standing or repeating orders (e.g. "push this button whenever someone walks past" or "carry all these packages one at a time to the next room"). If it becomes impossible to continue to do a given task for some reason, this spell ends.

The command must be quite simple and cannot include branching statements (e.g. "do this until X happens, then do that"). A doll cannot perform multiple tasks.
spells.duration: One day or until order is completed
spells.summary: A doll acts as caster commands

spells.name: Canine Perception
spells.description: For the spell's duration, the target gains a dog's superior sense of smell. The target gains a +1 bonus on all action checks in the Observation check package.
spells.summary: Observation checks +1

spells.name: Instant Undead
spells.description:
Creates and controls an undead. This spell consumes the same amount of MP and materials as [Create Undead] (3rd level Spiritualism spell), except for the duration.

When an undead is created with this spell, it must meet the class level restrictions equivalent to those of [Create Undead] in both Sorcerer and Conjurer. For example, a character with Sorcerer 3/Conjurer 5 can only create Undead up to level 3 with this spell.

The Undead created with this spell is limited to "Obey Command."
spells.summary: Instantly animate and command an Undead

spells.name: ⏩△Stubborn Survivor
spells.description:
This spell imbues the target with a stout life force similar to that of a tree. While under its effects, the target gains a +2 bonus to Fortitude and Willpower checks against poison and disease.

If the target is already under a poison or disease effect and a spell or effect is used to remove it, the Success Value of the spell or effect is increased by +2.
spells.summary: Gives protection against Poison and Disease types

spells.name: Daybreak*
spells.description:
This spell produces a fist-sized ball of light. All areas (30m radius) are treated as if they were under natural sunlight.

The ball of light floats around the caster and follows them automatically. It can be controlled to some extent by the caster's will, without the need for speech or action (either Major Action or Minor Action), but it never leaves the caster's location beyond 1 meter.

The caster can use a Major Action to throw the light ball, which will explode at the target location, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power energy magic damage to the target. If the target is Undead, the damage will be Power 40 + Magic Power instead. Even if multiple light balls are prepared, only one light ball can be thrown per Major Action.

Throwing a light ball is handled in the same way as casting spells. The caster should make a new Spellcasting check to determine the success value and compares that value with the target's Willpower. Once a light ball explodes, the spell that created it ends.

Thrown Light Ball

Target: 1 area (5m Radius)/15, Range/Area: 1 (10m) / Shot, Duration: Instant, Resistance: Half, Type: Energy
spells.summary: Creates a light ball and illuminates surroundings in a 30-meter radius

spells.name: Mighty Daemon
spells.description:
Gives more power to your summoned Daemons.

When a Daemon summoned from an Abyss Gate performs an action on the Daemon Action Chart during the duration of the effect, it will deal +3 Physical Damage and Magic Damage. For the following 1 hour, Banish checks receive a -1 penalty.
spells.summary: Summoned Daemon's damage +3

spells.name: Current
spells.description:
This spell targets one river or stream within the caster's sight. The caster can change the speed at which the water flows to a maximum speed of 50 km/h, as well as change the direction of the flow. The caster cannot be more than 30 meters away from the current they are trying to control. With this spell, a river can flow swiftly uphill, or the caster can slow a raging waterfall to a gentle sprinkle.

If the caster is in a boat, this spell affects the water directly underneath them.
spells.summary: Manipulates the water flow

spells.name: Machina Wings*
spells.description:
Gives the target the power of Aurmata's mechanical wings.

The target can fly for the duration of the spell, with a Normal Move of 30.

The target cannot take any Major Action while flying under the effect of this spell.
spells.summary: Possible to fly with movement 30

spells.name: Lightning March*
spells.description:
This spell grants healthy legs and long marches will no longer be a chore.

All affected targets increase their Normal Move by +20m, and Full Move by +60m. In addition, affected characters are not subject to penalties for not eating and sleeping for the duration of this spell.

Armies that receive this magical blessing can advance at three times their normal speed.
spells.summary: Movement +20, no food and sleep penalties

spells.name: Bad Halation
spells.description:
The target is shown a nightmare-like vision, drawing their attention away.

The target suffers -1 to Evasion and Willpower checks for the duration of the effect.

Enhancement 1:

Resistance is changed to Temporary.

Enhancement 2:

Attribute is changed to Curse.
spells.summary: Target's Evasion and Willpower -1

spells.name: Lock
spells.description: You lock any object which can be locked. An object locked with this spell behaves as if locked normally. Anything with a lock can be affected.
spells.summary: Uses mana to close a lock tight

spells.name: ⏩△Change Position
spells.description:
The caster swaps positions with a doll or puppet within the spell's range. Walls, barriers, etc., are bypassed by this magic, but the spell fails if there is not enough space for the caster to safely exit in the doll's space before the replacement. This effect allows the caster to automatically escape from a skirmish.

This spell may only be used once per 10 seconds (1 round).
spells.summary: Instantly swaps positions with the doll

spells.name: Medical Kit
spells.description:
The magisphere extrudes equipment which can cure injuries and illnesses. This heals the target for Power 50 + Magic Power HP. This healing can affect constructs or Magitech, but not undead. If the target is a Runefolk, increase the recovery by +5 points.

Additionally, poisons, diseases, and petrification can be removed. For such effects, a contested check is needed.

This spell takes 10 minutes to cast.
spells.summary: Creates equipment to cure injuries and illnesses

spells.name: Fire Break
spells.description:
Creates a 1-meter-wide zone where fire cannot burn. The zone extends in a straight line 100 meters from the caster. For the duration, fire cannot cross the spell area; if a burning object (such as a torch) is brought into the spell's area, it will be extinguished.

This spell does not prevent Fire-type damage inside its area of effect.
spells.summary: Creates a zone where fire cannot burn

spells.name: Stun
spells.description:
Target automatically fails one Evasion check. As soon as it fails, the spell will end. Only the first Evasion check will fail for characters with multiple sections, regardless of which section attempts the check.

When casting this spell, the caster gets a +2 bonus to their Spellcasting check.
spells.summary: Stuns the target

spells.name: Cursed Doll
spells.description: A doll is used as a medium to cast a curse on the target, dealing Power 30 + Magic Power magic damage. When casting this spell, the caster must perform the action of stabbing the doll with their magical implement (the doll can be held in the other hand or placed on the ground in front of them). A doll used to cast this spell will break and become useless.
spells.summary: Inflicts Power 30 damage through the doll

spells.name: Mana Search
spells.description:
The magisphere transforms into a detector which shows the caster the location of all magical items within the area of effect. It does not inform the caster of the strength or type of magic.

The detection range depends on the size of the magisphere used: 1 area (10m radius) for a small magisphere, 2 areas (30m radius) for a medium sphere, and all areas (50m radius) for a large sphere.
spells.summary: Scans for items imbued with magic

spells.name: Chaos Shot
spells.description: Attacks with a condensed fairy energy wave, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage

spells.name: ⏩△Wing Flyer II
spells.description:
For the duration of the effect, the target can fly in the air (movement speed is the same as that on the ground). Also, the target gains a +2 bonus to all Accuracy checks for melee attacks and all Evasion checks made against melee attacks.

This spell does not overlap with other flying effects, such as [◯Flying] or [Sword's Grace/Wings Of The Wind].
spells.summary: Enables the target to fly quickly

spells.name: Go the Way*
spells.description:
During the spell's effect, the caster will be able to move in midair. The caster's path becomes a 1-meter wide track that emits light and can be used by others to move. Once the caster has created a track, it will not be lost even if the caster backtracks, and a new branch will occur if the caster steps out in a different direction.

While moving on the line, the caster's movement is limited to Normal Move, and the caster cannot perform Major Actions. In combat, using this light path does not allow the caster to avoid movement blocking or break away from a skirmish. However, the caster can move over a magic wall (see Magus Arts, p. 76) as if the wall wasn't there.

After the spell duration expires, the line of light disappears.
spells.summary: Create a track of light while walking through the air

spells.name: Thermal Illusion
spells.description:
Creates illusions that deceive the target's thermal senses.

The size of the illusion must fit within the space of a 3m radius. The illusion is not accompanied by images, sounds, and smells and cannot be touched. When a character enters the area of influence of the illusion, the temperature envisioned by the caster is sensed. The temperature can be set to anything from below freezing to the high temperature of a flame, but it cannot cause damage.

This spell can be combined with the magical illusion of [Illusion] (8th-level Spiritualism spell) and [Tactile Illusion] (9th level Deep Magic).

This spell can also be cast on characters or objects to change their perceived temperature. In that case, if they move, the hallucination will move accordingly. The illusioned object itself will not feel the false temperature.
spells.summary: Creates illusions that deceive the sense of temperature

spells.name: Protection III
spells.description: The target takes -4 damage from all physical and magical sources for the spell's duration. This spell does not affect Poison-, Disease-, or Curse-type damage.
spells.summary: Reduces target's damage by -4

spells.name: Lethal Dimension
spells.description:
Fills a large area with mana that causes damage, with the caster at the center.

All characters in the area take Power 30 + Magic Power points of damage at the end of their turn. This damage cannot be critical.

Immediately after taking damage, the target may make a Willpower check using the success value of the Spellcasting Check for this spell as the Target Number. If the check is successful, the target will not be affected by this effect thereafter.

If a character who leaves the spell's range during the effect period re-enters the area, they will continue to take damage if their Willpower checks never succeeded. If the character succeeded in even one Willpower check, this spell will no longer affect them even if they come back into range.
spells.summary: Creates a space that continuously deals Power 30 damage

spells.name: Exorcism
spells.description:
This spell is only effective on Undead monsters of Level 8 or lower.

Sets the target's HP and MP to 0. The target will crumble into dust on the spot.
spells.summary: Destroys Undead level 8 and below

spells.name: Summon Fairy V
spells.description: This spell is identical to [Summon Fairy], except the monster level of the fairy to be called is 11.
spells.summary: Calls and uses a level 11 Fairy

spells.name: Skyship
spells.description:
Creates a Skyship (see CR III, p. 390). This spell requires the use of 5 magispheres (large). These magispheres don't need to be equipped to be used for this spell. The magispheres making up the skyship cannot be used to cast other Magitech during the spell's duration.

This spell takes 10 minutes (60 rounds) to cast.
spells.summary: Creates a small airship

spells.name: Sound Bomb
spells.description:
Creates a "bomb" of magical energy in the caster's hand. Throwing this bomb makes a small sound. When a bomb lands on the target, it will emit a burst, a whistle, or an animal cry for a brief time. The caster decides what kind of sound it will make, but it must be one that the caster has heard before.

The bomb can say a word, but it will be limited to just one word.
spells.summary: Makes a small noise

spells.name: Hide Value*
spells.description:
This spell magically decorates the target item to make it appear of high value.

It makes the base price of the item appear to be twice its original price, effectively doubling the price at the time of sale (note that the original base price remains the same.)

To detect this spell, compare the Success Value of the spell with the Success Value of the character's Appraise check. If the character suspects that this spell was cast, they may substitute an Appraise check for a Detect check.
spells.summary: Create a false impression of double monetary value

spells.name: Rescue
spells.description:
For the duration of the spell, the caster knows the target's current HP, regardless of distance. The caster only knows the HP status of the target but no other effects or conditions. With the target's consent, the caster can call the target to their side as a Minor Action. This can bypass walls, barriers, etc., but will fail if there is not enough space for the target to safely exist in the space where they are summoned.

Once this recall effect is used, or if the caster casts this spell on another target, the spell ends.
spells.summary: Know the target's health, and save them from dire situations

spells.name: Copy Doll
spells.description:
A doll or stuffed animal is transformed to look exactly the same size and appearance as the caster. Despite being a doll, the caster can manipulate the new body as if it were their own, retaining all abilities and still requiring food and sleep. It is impossible to tell that the target is a doll by observing its appearance and behavior.

While separated, the caster's original body is unconscious. At any time, the caster can know the condition of their body but cannot perceive through it. If the caster's body dies, the caster also dies. If the spell's duration ends or the caster ends it, the caster will return to its body.

If the doll's HP drops to 0, the caster returns to its original body while the doll's body crumbles into useless dust.

While this spell is in effect, the caster can't cast this spell on another target.
spells.summary: Creates a doll indistinguishable from the caster

spells.name: Water Bridge*
spells.description:
For the duration of the effect, the caster can create a bridge made of water in space. The bridge must be between 1 and 10 meters in width and depth, with a slight upward arch in the middle, between 10 and 100 meters in length. The caster determines the width, depth, and length, but the shape is limited to a straight line, and the arch is limited to a reasonable design.

The caster can build bridges as many times as they want within the spell's duration, taking a Major Action each time. Once a bridge is built, it remains for the duration of the spell and cannot be erased or destroyed, even if the caster wills it.

Water bridges, including previously built bridges, cannot be built over existing structures or characters (although they can be crossed by arches). Water bridges have a flow toward either side of the straight line. The flow speed can be freely determined by the caster for each bridge, ranging from a rushing current to a turbulent one.

Water bridges can be navigated on the water using boats or other means, and swimming through them is possible.
spells.summary: Build a water bridge

spells.name: ⏩Sniper Range
spells.description:
When the target makes a ranged attack, the range is extended. In Simplified Combat, "Range: 1" becomes "Range: 2." In Standard Combat, the range increase depends on the size of the magisphere used to cast this spell: 500 meters for Large, 30 meters for Medium, and 10 meters for Small.

The range of an attack cannot be extended more than twice the attack's original range with this spell. For example, if the original range is 40m, the extended ranges by Large, Medium, and Small magispheres are 80m, 70m, and 50m, respectively.
spells.summary: Extend the range of ranged attacks

spells.name: ⏩Critical Preparation*
spells.description:
Create a magic trap around the caster that inflicts damage on the character who acts the most violently.

During the spell's duration, all characters within the area of effect must keep a running tally of the number of times they roll 2d for skill checks, damage rolls (including critical hits), and determine damage for fixed-value characters. At the beginning of the caster's next turn, the character who has recorded the highest number of rolls is dealt Power 80 + Magic Power magic damage. If there are multiple characters with the highest number, all of them are dealt damage.

A character with multiple sections should keep a separate tally for each section. Note that the duration of this spell cannot be extended using [Metamagic/Time].
spells.summary: Deals Power 80 damage to the one that rolls the most times

spells.name: ⏩︎△Water Dweller
spells.description:
While under the effects of this spell, the target can breathe underwater and has no movement or action restrictions.

Additionally, they gain the ability to speak in the Sea Animal language. However, understanding this language when spoken back to them requires separate mastery of the Sea Animal language.

While underwater, the target will be unable to speak any other language.
spells.summary: Allows target to act underwater

spells.name: Big Flight
spells.description:
The caster must select themselves as one of the targets. If there are more targets in the affected area than the maximum allowed, the caster is always selected first by the [Magic Control] Combat Feat, and then the remaining targets are chosen randomly from the remainder.

Roc's Spirit wraps around the targets and carries them through the sky. The caster can freely choose the direction and altitude of the flight, with speeds of up to 60 km/h and altitudes of up to 10,000 meters.

While being carried, the targets (including the caster) cannot perform Major Actions.

The caster can cancel the spell on each target individually, but if the caster cancels their own effect, all other targets will be canceled as well. If a target is at a high altitude when the spell is canceled, it will suffer falling damage.
spells.summary: Carried away by air

spells.name: Light
spells.description:
2-3 areas (10m radius) centered on the target will be illuminated with light. No creatures within this area will be be affected by the darkness penalty.

This spell can be cast on an object and carried around. It cannot be cast directly on a character.
spells.summary: Illuminate a 10-meter radius with light

spells.name: Create Weapon
spells.description:
Transforms the caster's magisphere into a magic weapon which still deals physical damage. The weapon must be chosen from the non-magical weapons list of A-Rank or less. The transformed magisphere cannot be used to cast Magitech during the transformation.

The weapon normally appears in the caster's hand, but it can also be created as a weapon to enhance a Kick and immediately become equipped. This weapon can also be passed to others.
spells.summary: Transforms magisphere into magical melee weapon

spells.name: Tunnel
spells.description: Eliminates non-magical earth and rocks, as well as clay, bricks, and other substances made from these materials, in the target area. As a result, a tunnel can be dug in the ground, or a hole can be made in stone walls (including [Stone Wall]). The area of effect can be defined by the caster within the 2x2x10m limit, but the area must be a simple circular or polygonal column and cannot be bent in the middle.
spells.summary: Dig into dirt or stone

spells.name: Ultimate Healing
spells.description:
This spell heals the target's HP by a maximum of 100 points.

Note: Fairy Magic of the Light type has no effect on Constructs, Magitech, or Undead.
spells.summary: Recovers 100 points of target's HP

spells.name: Entrapment
spells.description:
Thick earthen arms extend from the ground and catch the target. For the spell's duration, the target's movement becomes 0, and it suffers a -2 penalty to its Evasion checks.

This spell cannot affect a character with multiple sections or a character who is moving without touching the ground. However, if a character is caught by this spell while on the ground, it cannot fly even if it has the Flying ability, and it loses [Sword's Grace/Wings of the Wind] and other abilities similar to [〇Flying].

The target of this spell may attempt to escape by using a Major Action on its turn. The target must make a skill check using either its Fortitude or Willpower, or use Adventurer Level + Strength modifier (optional) as its standard value. If the target obtains a higher success value, the spell ends. If the target rolls automatic success, the Success Value is compared using the +5 rule (see CR I, p. 92).
spells.summary: Extend earthen arms from the ground to catch the target

spells.name: Savage Discord*
spells.description:
The target assumes that a character specified by the caster is an enemy and viciously attacks them. Only one character can be specified. The target will use its own turn to attack the specified character with whatever weapon (e.g., Claws or Bite for a monster) it is currently equipped with. In general, this attack should be picked by GM as the most efficient attack without penalties to the target, with unique skills to increase its effectiveness if applicable. However, if the equipped weapon is a ranged weapon, the target must be willing to spend ammunition. [Solid Bullet] will be used if the weapon is a gun.

This spell has no effect if the targeted character cannot attack.
spells.summary: Confuses the target into attacking allies

spells.name: Avoid Healing*
spells.description: The target will no longer be able to be affected by effects that restore HP. This spell prevents simple healing spells such as [Cure Wounds], the stun recovery spell [Awaken], [Drain Touch], and items that restore HP. If effects also restore MP with HP, both effects will be nullified.
spells.summary: Target cannot be healed

spells.name: Trail Guide*
spells.description:
Determines the path or corridor to the desired location.

When this spell is cast, the caster designates a place that the caster has actually visited as the destination. That place doesn't need to be visible at the time of casting. Once the spell has been cast, the entire non-blocked path to the destination will appear luminous to the caster for the duration of the spell.

Whatever the complexity of the path, if it eventually leads to the destination, the path will glow. It is useful for choosing a fork in the road and determining which way to go on a single path.

A trail or pathway is also treated as a path, but if there is a place (including a closed door, etc.) where the caster's body cannot pass, the path or passage is considered to be cut off there (i.e., the shining will not lead past there).

This spell will have no affect unless the caster is standing on an obvious path or passageway.
spells.summary: Shows the path that leads to a destination

spells.name: Emergency Arrival*
spells.description:
This spell instantly teleports the caster to the location of a Humanoid target when they call for help.

The target must have an Adventurer Level (or monster level, if fixed) that is at least three levels lower than the caster's Adventurer Level. For example, if the caster is level 13, the target must be level 10 or lower.

If the target requests help from the caster within a day of the spell being cast, the caster will sense it immediately, regardless of distance. If willing, the caster can teleport instantly to the target.

10 seconds (1 round) following the teleportation, the caster may act.

The spell ends after the target requests help once, regardless of whether the caster teleports or not.
spells.summary: Move instantly to target in case of danger

spells.name: Bind Operation
spells.description:
The target of this spell can only perform a Limited Move or less, and all action checks (CR I, p. 155) receive a -2 penalty.

Runefolk, Constructs, and Magitech creatures receive a -2 penalty to Willpower to resist this spell.
spells.summary: Restrict the movement of the target

spells.name: Draw Out
spells.description:
Deals Power 10 + Magic Power magical damage to both the target's HP and MP while restoring the caster's MP equal to the applied damage. However, MP recovery is limited to 1/10th of the target's maximum MP (rounded up).

This spells exceptionally restores the caster's HP and MP even if the target resists.
spells.summary: Absorbs the HP and MP of the target

spells.name: Oracle
spells.description:
The caster can project their voice to any character within the range of the spell who is also a priest of the same god.

Only characters with at least 1 level in the Priest class can hear the caster. The caster cannot hear any responses from those they talk to, regardless of faith.
spells.summary: Projects caster's voice to distant believers

spells.name: Total Sanity
spells.description: Removes all effects of Psychic and Curse + Psychic types on target. There is no need to compare success values.
spells.summary: Return the target's mental state to normal

spells.name: Ray*
spells.description: A beam of light bursts forth, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magical damage. Undead creatures take additional +3 damage only on failed resistance.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage, Undead +3

spells.name: Pebble Shot
spells.description: Launches a pebble at high speed, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage

spells.name: Teleoperate Doll
spells.description:
This spell can be cast on a doll in a remote location to gain the effects of [Remote Doll] (6th-level Spiritualism spell).

This spell can only be applied to dolls that have been marked for this spell by the caster. An hour-long ritual is required for the mark to be drawn, and the doll must be at least a week old before it can be subjected to this spell. Only one mark can be drawn on a single doll.

The mark is permanent but will be automatically deactivated if it is erased or a new mark is drawn. The number of dolls a caster can mark simultaneously is limited to a number equal to the level of the caster's Sorcerer or Conjurer class, whichever is lower. If the caster draws more than this number, they will randomly lose an existing one.
spells.summary: Moves a doll in a remote location to scout

spells.name: Blood Branded
spells.description:
The caster points at the target and inflicts a small wound as if a Daemon had scratched them with its claws.

The target takes 2 points of magic damage, and the Caster regains HP equal to the applied damage.

This spell is effective even if either the caster or the target is an Undead, Construct, or Magitech character.
spells.summary: Absorbs 2 HP from the target

spells.name: Dimension Sword
spells.description: Attack with a blade that cleaves through space itself, dealing Power 60 + Magic Power of magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 60 damage

spells.name: ⏩Berserk*
spells.description: While affected by this spell, the caster increases their Accuracy, Fortitude, and Willpower by 3 points and deals an extra +6 physical damage. However, they also receive a -3 penalty to their Evasion and cannot cast any other spells.
spells.summary: Fly into an anger-fueled rage

spells.name: Resistant Clothes*
spells.description:
This spell increases the durability and cutting resistance of clothing and light armor to better protect the wearer.

If the target is equipped with nonmetallic armor, their Defense is increased by +1. Additionally, when the target is damaged by a spell that isn't of the Poison, Disease, Curse, or Psychic type, the damage is reduced by 1 point.

Furthermore, the target's nonmetallic armor becomes immune to any effects that could reduce its Defense, such as corrosion, for the duration of the spell. The GM has the final say on which effects are affected by this spell.
spells.summary: Defense +1 for nonmetallic armor, magic damage with type -1

spells.name: Grace of Lumiere*
spells.description:
Grants the target a fraction of Lumiere's grace.

Choose one of the following: [Sword's Grace/Change Fate], [Sword's Grace/Gentle Water], [Sword's Grace/Body Of Flame], or [Sword's Grace/Wings Of The Wind]. The caster cannot choose an ability the target already has. The effect of [Sword's Grace] given to the target is equivalent to first level, regardless of the level of the target.
spells.summary: Grants the target a fraction of Lumiere's grace

spells.name: Execution
spells.description:
Destroy one Abyss Core that exists within the Shallow Abyss. The Shallow Abyss where the Abyss Core has been destroyed will disappear after 10 minutes (60 rounds).

If the target Abyss Core is one that the caster has created using [Fulfillment], the range of this spell will change to "Infinite," and it will be possible to use it without needing to see the target (if it is destroyed, the caster will die).

Enhancement:

When this spell is cast, the target Abyss Core can be destroyed at any time from immediately to one hour later. When the set time comes, the effect of this spell will appear no matter what the situation or location of the caster, and the Abyss Core will be destroyed.

If the Abyss Core targeted by this effect is destroyed before the effect is complete, the spell will be lost if [Perfect Cancellation] or other such spells are cast on it.
spells.summary: Destroy the Abyss Core

spells.name: Instant Golem
spells.description:
Creates and deploys a Golem. This spell consumes the same amount of MP and materials as [Create Golem] (3rd level Spiritualism spell), except for the duration.

When a golem is created with this spell, it must meet the class level restrictions equivalent to those of [Create Golem] in both Sorcerer and Conjurer. For example, a character with Sorcerer 3/Conjurer 5 can only create a Golem up to level 3 with this spell.

The Golem created with this spell is limited to "Obey Command."
spells.summary: Instantly create a Golem

spells.name: Wire Anchor
spells.description:
The magisphere transforms into a grappling gun. The moment this spell is cast, a 30m long wire with a grapnel at the end shoots forth and entangles the target. The wire is extremely strong and can support up to 200 kg of weight. It can be used to climb a wall or to lift or brace the caster. The wire can wind itself up slowly (10 meters per 10 seconds), so it can be used to carry the caster and their gear upwards. Any amount of rewinding is a Major Action.

If used on a character, make a Spellcasting check versus the Evasion of the target. If this check fails, the target is entangled by the wire, suffering a -2 penalty to Evasion checks, and cannot move more than 30m away from the caster. You may also pull the target toward the caster by winding the wire (up to 10m in 10 seconds) as a Major Action.

Special note: if the number of sections of the target are greater than the caster, the target will not receive the above penalty to their Evasion check, and reeling in the wire will pull the caster toward the target instead.
spells.summary: Fires a wire with a hook attached, grappling onto targets

spells.name: Fire Blast
spells.description: A fireball explodes at the point of impact, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magic damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 10 damage

spells.name: Summon Fairy II
spells.description: This spell is identical to [Summon Fairy], except the monster level of the fairy to be called is 5.
spells.summary: Calls and uses a level 5 Fairy

spells.name: Troops of Ignis*
spells.description: If the target is Barbarous, that character can use Dalkhrem's Specialized Divine Spells up to the 7th level for the duration of this spell.
spells.summary: Allows Barbarous to cast Dalkhrem's Specialized Divine Spells

spells.name: ⏩Solid Bullet
spells.description: Infuses a bullet with destructive power. The bullet deals Power 20 + Magic Power magic damage if it hits.
spells.summary: Infuses a bullet with Power 20

spells.name: Phantom Blur
spells.description:
The target is surrounded by an Abyssal Miasma that blurs their outline, posture, and appearance, making it difficult to grasp their true form.

The target gains +1 to Evasion checks for the duration of the effect.

This spell has no effect on targets with Perception: Mechanical.

Enhancement:

Changes Spell to "Target: 1 area (radius 3m) / 5."
spells.summary: Evasion +1

spells.name: Respite from Shallow Abyss*
spells.description:
Creates a barrier with a radius of about 10 meters where one can stay safely. Only characters approved by the caster at the time of spellcasting can enter or exit the affected area during the effect.

The created space cannot move and does not obstruct vision. It also does not block sounds or smells.

Characters not approved by the caster cannot interfere with the created space by any means. One must attempt a Success Value comparison using [Dispel Magic] or a similar effect to dispel the space itself. This spell only takes effect within a Shallows or an environment deemed equivalent by the GM. Additionally, if any character not approved by the caster is present within the range, the spell does not take effect.
spells.summary: Creates a barrier for safe rest within a Shallow Abyss

spells.name: Flame Arrow
spells.description: Creates and shoots an arrow of elemental fire, dealing Power 20 + Magic Power magical damage to the target.
spells.summary: Deals Power 20 damage

spells.name: Peace*
spells.description:
Subjects who fail to resist become non-hostile and will no longer actively participate in combat. If possible, they will also attempt to stop others on their side from engaging in combat, and will avoid starting new hostilities for the duration of the spell.

This effect ends if another character is overly hostile toward the target, or the target is attacked.
spells.summary: Calms emotions and suppresses instincts

spells.name: Resist Bomb
spells.description: The caster chooses Fire, Water/Ice, Earth, Wind, or Lightning upon casting the spell. Creatures in the area take 4 points less damage from the selected type and will not be affected by negative non-damage effects of the selected type.
spells.summary: Reduces damage from a specific type by -4

spells.name: Cure Mortality
spells.description:
Heals the target for Power 70 + Magic Power HP. This spell has no effect on Constructs and Magitech characters. If the target is Undead, this spell deals Power 70 + Magic Power damage instead.

This damage cannot be critical.
spells.summary: Heals target with Power 70

spells.name: Fire Mauler
spells.description: Creates a fireball that rolls in a straight line from the caster, dealing Power 60 + Magic Power of magic damage to anything in its path.
spells.summary: Deals Power 60 damage

spells.name: ⏩Ultimate Being*
spells.description:
For the duration of the spell, the caster may arbitrarily choose any effects they do not wish to receive and ignore their effects. Declared effects are treated as temporarily absent (they are not abolished completely, but are re-applied at the end of the duration of this spell).

Also, the caster gains a +2 bonus to all action checks during the spell's duration if there is even one effect to ignore.
spells.casting_time: 1 Minor Action or during Combat Preparation
spells.summary: Ignore all disadvantageous effects; Action checks +2

spells.name: Command
spells.description:
The caster gives a new order to a Construct, Golem, or Undead with an Intellect of "None," "Animal," or "Low." Treat it as if it was given an "Obey Command" directive. If the spell is successful, the caster takes control immediately, but cannot start giving instructions until the next turn after this spell was cast.

If the original controller of the target monster is known, the original controller and the caster must compare their Spellcasting success values, and the caster must win. If not (or if the undead or golem is acting independently), the caster must win versus the monster's Willpower. In this case, the monster receives a +4 bonus.

After the spell's duration expires, the monster's control returns to the original controller. If the target worked independently, it would again begin to act according to its behavior and motives.

This spell can also be used to change commands given to Golems and Undead which were created by the caster.
spells.summary: Gain control of Undead or Golem

spells.name: Thunder Bolt
spells.description: Fires a bolt of lightning at the target, dealing Power 50 + Magic Power of magical damage.
spells.summary: Deals Power 50 damage

spells.name: Raging Earth
spells.description: Each creature in the area regenerates 3 points of damage at the end of its turn. This spell even heals undead, constructs, and Magitech targets.
spells.summary: Heals 3 points every round

spells.name: Transfer Mana
spells.description:
The target gains as much MP as the extra points spent in casting. For example, if 10 MP were used to cast the spell, the target would gain 9 MP.

If the caster uses the combat feat [Metamagic/Targets] to increase the number of targets, they will restore the same amount of MP to all of them. The maximum number of MP that can be transferred with this spell is 20 (for a total MP cost of 21).

The Combat Feat [MP Save/Priest] or similar combat feats cannot be used to reduce the cost of this spell.
spells.summary: Gives the caster's MP to the target

spells.name: ⏩Replace Sound
spells.description: Any vocalizations made by the caster during the duration of the spell will be heard from the target location, not the actual position of the caster. The effect does not apply to sounds other than voice.
spells.summary: Generates the caster's voice in a different location

spells.name: Panacea Light
spells.description: This spell summons a warm light around the target which purifies the mind. All Psychic-type effects from the area are automatically removed, without the need for contested checks.
spells.summary: Calls a warm light that purifies the mind

spells.name: Natural Power
spells.description:
Caster draws magic from nature and uses it to temporarily power their Nature Magic spells. Upon casting this spell, the caster gains Power 10 MP (no criticals). This MP can only be used to cast Nature Magic and may be combined with the caster's own MP or with a Mako Stone.

This spell only works if the caster is in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101).

The temporary MP granted by this spell disappears at the end of the caster's turn.

Note: Since this spell requires a Major Action to cast, the temporary MP gained by this spell is generally used to cast Nature Magic with a Minor Action. However, it is possible to allocate extra MP to Nature Magic cast with a Major Action by declaring the Combat Feat [Double Cast], receiving the effect of the [Haste] spell, and so on.
spells.summary: Gain temporary MP

spells.name: Evil Dream
spells.description:
This spell can be cast without a line of sight to the target, as long as the caster possesses a part of the intended target's body (e.g., a lock of hair). The target has nightmares whenever they sleep (the content of the nightmares is freely determined by the caster) and suffers the disadvantage of missing sleep (see CR I, p. 184).

This spell requires a one-hour ritual to cast. In addition, to sustain the effect, the ritual must be performed for another hour every day, consuming MP when cast. This sustaining ritual can be performed anywhere, but requires the part of the target's body originally used when casting the spell. If the sustaining ritual cannot be performed, the spell ends.

The caster cannot perform any Actions while performing the ritual. A [Distraction] spell will cancel the ritual.

The number of targets cannot be increased with [Metamagic/Targets] combat feat. It is still possible to curse multiple targets if the caster performs the rituals separately.
spells.summary: Haunts the target with horrific nightmares

spells.name: ⏩△Daemon's Blade
spells.description:
The Caster gains the Daemon's Blade magical sword listed below as a melee weapon for the duration of the effect.

Whem attacking with this weapon, an Accuracy Check can be performed with Warlock Level + Dexterity Bonus. The additional damage is Magic Power.

For a character with Monster data, the accuracy is "Magic Power (Magic Power + 7)", and the Damage is "2d + (Magic Power + 8)".

When dealing damage with this weapon, you can choose each time whether the applied damage is to HP or MP.
spells.power_table:

spells.summary: Create a melee weapon with Power 50

spells.name: Intense Control
spells.description:
This spell can only target dolls, Golems, Undead, Familiars, etc. which the caster has created or given orders to. It cannot affect any other characters.

The target gains a +2 bonus to its Accuracy and Evasion. In addition, the spell increases all damage the target deals by +2 and reduces all physical and magical damage it receives by -2.
spells.summary: Strengthens a Familiar, Golem, or Undead created by the caster.

spells.name: Virtual Friend
spells.description:
The target believes the caster to be a close friend. The target will act to provide the caster with as much convenience as possible and will respect the caster's intentions.

This effect is lost immediately if the caster reveals any hostile intent towards the target. If this spell is cast on a character from an opposing faction during combat, the effect is lost at the start of the caster's next turn.

If this effect is used in a Shallow Abyss or similar environment, the caster gains a +2 bonus to their success value.

Enhancement:

Changes Duration to 1 hour.
spells.summary: Makes the target think that the caster is a close friend

spells.name: Silent Move
spells.description:
All of the target's movements become completely silent. Footsteps and other such noises are inaudible, and even actions like opening and closing doors are quiet. Stepping on a creaking floor would make no sound. This spell does not prevent sounds from things the target is not touching. For example, a flower pot knocked to the ground would be audible.

If the target says anything or deliberately makes a noise, that noise is audible, and the spell immediately ends.
spells.summary: Target moves without making a sound

spells.name: Tinder
spells.description: Ignites combustible materials. This spell can ignite objects that could be lit with a single match.
spells.summary: Ignites flammable objects

spells.name: Marsavra Smash
spells.description: Huge Marsavra's Spirit appears and crushes the caster's surroundings. Roll 2d and determine the physical damage to be dealt to the target using the table below.
spells.power_table:
2d Damage
2-6 Hits slightly. This attack deals 18 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
7-9 Spirit hits with sufficient weight. This attack deals a 21 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
10-12 A direct hit crushes victims, resulting in 24 + Magic Power points of physical damage.
spells.summary: Deals (18-24 + Magic Power) physical damage

spells.name: Distress Reading*
spells.description:
The caster learns all of the problems, sufferings, or difficulties the target is currently facing, along with the circumstances that created the challenges.

If the target is not directly aware of any difficulty it is facing, this spell will not reveal its contents.
spells.summary: Know the target's problems and suffering
spells.divinity: Miritsa, Goddess of Love and Vengeance

spells.name: Affirmation of Faith
spells.description:
This spell creates a field blessed by the caster's deity and inhibits the intervention of other deities.

Targets will no longer be able to cast Specialized Divine Magic of a deity different from the caster for the duration of the spell.
spells.summary: Caster affirms their faith and rebukes the magic of other gods

spells.name: Refresh
spells.description: Removes all poisons and disease effects from the target. No comparison of success values is necessary. This spell cannot heal Poison- or Disease-type damage that has already been applied.
spells.summary: Calls upon the divine to heal the target of all ailments

spells.name: ⏩△Fire Protector
spells.description: Crimson Maggot's Spirit protects the target, which suffers no damage and no unwanted effects of the Fire type for the duration of the effect. The effects of any Fire type that the target has already received are not removed completely, but are temporarily suspended for the duration of the spell.
spells.summary: Fully protects the target from flames

spells.name: Cure Disease
spells.description: Dispels all Poison- and Disease-type spells and effects on the target. This requires a contested check.
spells.summary: Cleanses the target's body of poison and disease

spells.name: ⏩△Heat Weapon*
spells.description: Whenever the target makes a melee attack, the weapon used in the attack is treated as a Fire-type weapon, and the physical damage it causes is increased by +2.
spells.summary: Heats the caster's weapon to incredible temperatures, +2 damage

spells.name: Autonomous Shield
spells.description:
When the target takes physical or magical damage while this spell is in effect, the damage can be reduced by 2d. The target chooses whether or not to apply this effect after they have actually taken damage and the total damage has been determined. The 2d value to be reduced is determined by rolling dice when the target chooses to apply this effect. Once the effect has been applied, the spell ends.

The 2d rolled when reducing cannot be altered by [Sword's Grace/Change Fate] or any other effects that increase, decrease, or change the result of a dice roll.

This effect can only be applied once per day to the same target.

Enhancement 1:

Change the target of this spell to "1 Character" and the "Range/Area" to "2 (30m) / Target."

Enhancement 2:

You can choose to ignore the "This effect can only be applied once per day to the same target" clause and continue to use the spell.
spells.summary: The Abyss itself is used as a shield to protect against harm

spells.name: See-Through
spells.description: The target area becomes transparent, allowing the caster to see through to the other side. However, creatures, characters, equipment, and clothing become invisible only to the caster and continue to exist there. Objects viewed through this area can be targeted by magic, though magic with "Area: Shot" will be blocked due to obstruction.
spells.summary: Allows caster to see through the target area

spells.name: Abyssal Legion
spells.description:
Strengthens the target's actions within the Shallow. If the target is in the Shallow Abyss or a similar environment, they gain a +2 Accuracy bonus during the duration of the effect, as well as +2 damage to physical and magical damage dealt.

Enhancement 1:

In addition to the original effect, gain a +2 bonus to Fortitude and Willpower checks, as well as -2 to physical and magical damage taken.

Enhancement 2:

Changes "Target" to "1 area (Radius 6m) / 20."
spells.summary: +2 Accuracy and +2 damage in a Shallow Abyss

spells.name: Create Undead
spells.description:
The caster creates an undead creature and gives it a command to act. For more information, see "Golems and Undead" (CRB II p. 87, or Magus Arts p. 86).

Casting this spell takes one hour.

* Can be replaced by Magical Bones (500G)
spells.power_table:
